Reviews.Title: “No Sea View”
Reviews.Author: LRS876
Reviews.Content: We paid to upgrade our room to "Sea"view. We checked into a room on the 9th floor and our view was of the adjacent buildings that were under construction. There was no view of the beach from our room. The front desk did not refund us for the upgrade we paid nor did they change our room to a higher floor. We spent 6 days looking at buildings under construction. We found one of the receptionist to be very rude. The rooms were not 5 star quality, very basic. The location was far from the inner Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, chic, funky in Poblenou”
Reviews.Author: PandoraSkies
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to be close to business colleagues, not typically where I stay in Barcelona. However, just a 5 mins walk direct to the beach front, and a leisurely 20 mins stroll along to the port. ME is cool, from rop to bottom. Uber design, this has every modernity you can imagine, although rooms are fairly small (but then again, you dont visit barcelona to be cooped in a room!) - neon lights, mood lighting, power monsoon showers and sounddocks. Added fun comes in a ritter-sport stocked mini bar, with a special Love Me Tender late night bag, for those that dont wnat to sleep (feather and massage gel included!). Free wifi from room and lobby, and chic lounge bar with slump sofas and chess boards, and DJ at weekend. The pool is great, as is the outside cocktail bar. Club was under refurb during my stay, but the lobby restaurant is spectacular for food (tip: order the Solomillo!)

Reviews.Title: “No way is this a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: atime4pleasure
Reviews.Content: The people working at the reception are pretentious. They think they are above their own guests. Even after informing them of an issue they say they will take care of it. But it never is. They make promises they cannot keep. When I asked at check-in if it was possible to have a room with a view of the sea I was told the hotel was fully booked. I then asked another receptionist and they said the hotel had rooms available. When I arrived in my room and went to the mini bar for some water. I found that the previous guests had opened and left the 2 bottles half empty. In any hotel, the mini bar should be re-stocked and changed immediately when the room is prepared for the next guest. The hallways seem to have a musty or mold smell to them despite this being a relatively new hotel. The conference rooms are located in the dark floors of -1. They have mold issues down there as one person who has a mold allergy had to be taken to hospital. The food in the restaurant is nothing near 5 star. The food is closer to 2 star. Even I could cook better than their main chef. The only thing that is 5 star in the restaurant are the prices. The staff in the restaurant are very nice. The hotel itself is 5KMs outside of the centre of Barcelona. If you are looking for a real 5 star hotel consider the W. It is right on the waterfront. The ME is about 7 blocks away or a 20 minute walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: regjr13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise. The hotel was amazing. We enjoyed the view, the dining, the live music playing in the lobby. All-in-all, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Luxury in modern and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oakely52
Reviews.Content: As you'll see from the photos that other travellers have uploaded on here, the rooms are beautifully designed, I loved the novelty of being able to see my bedroom whilst brushing my teeth in the bathroom- plus it made the room feel so much bigger! I think they've used the space very cleverly with both the wardrobe and shower behind a sliding door. The bed was extremely comfortable, it was like laying on a cloud. The shower was large and very powerful, and the little complimentary toiletry bottles were welcomed- we we're even given mouthwash! We had a view looking onto the Avenue Diagonal, and due to being so high up we had some beautiful views accross Barcelona. Sky bar is within the hotel in the lobby and the staff made me a couple of delicious cocktails, complete with a decorational strawberry. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the Poblenou metro (yellow line) which goes straight to the harbour area where most of the restaurants and bars are. It's also round the corner from the Pere IV tram stop which links to other mainline metro routes. Though it's not walking distance to the beach, you'll find yourself getting public transport anyway as the metro is so quick and handy to get from a to b. I would recommend getting a 3 day travelcard, or for however many days your there to use all types of transport, including trains. I would love to return to Barcelona and stay here again, or maybe another Melia hotel somewhere accross the globe to compare it too.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon J
Reviews.Content: A very different but trendy hotel on Av Diagonal. The staff are the best, very friendly and helpful, It is a 10 min walk to the beach and you can reach 2 shopping malls in about 10 mins. The pool area is quite small and the spa was closed for refubishment when I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Cyrusdgreat
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel for three nights and come back again and again when in Barcellona. The staff were so nice and hotel was new. The breakfast buffet is till 12:00 which was excellent. The business center was accessible for 24 hours and people working there were as responsible as your own secretary. Hotel is near to subway station. I've no hesitation to recommand this hotel to any business man.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leila B
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend went to the ME Barcelona. The hotel was very nice and the room was beautifully decorated. Lovely views of the city, our room had a full wall of window. The room was very clean had nice bathroom with a huge walk in shower. The bed was very big and comfortable. All the staff we dealt with were very nice. The pool decking area on the 6th floor looked amazing however we didn't use it as the weather was very cold (although were tempted after a few drinks!). Downsides to this hotel were that it is quite far from the city centre however not too far from a main metro line and some nice cafes/shops. The price was very high for extras eg mini bar, hotel drinks and meals, spa services, there were no tea or coffee facilities in the room. On the Saturday there was a night club in the hotel, we were told of this on arrival and invited to it, we went to the club for a drink however it was very expensive (16euro for a rum and coke and a small coke!), we left the club in the early hours 1-2am and could still slightly hear it in our room, although it didn't keep us awake (we were on the 18th floor and the club was on the 6th) and the club went on for several hours after we left. Overall a wonderful hotel, staff made a real effort to make us feel very welcome (gave us complimentary chocolates and bottled water) Perfect hotel for young trendy couples looking for a nice quality hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MrsSazzleH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary for 5 nights. The first impression of the hotel was very modern and had high expectations. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Poblenou Metro on the yellow line, which I would say is about 15 mins for the centre. If you are staying here, I would definitely recommend the metro card. When we were checking in we were railroaded into upgrading to a superior room which we were under the impression we already were however with it being our anniversary hubby wanted the best. Seemingly you pay extra from a sea view and a bath so in my opinion not worth it at all. There was no tea/coffee facilities in the room - this would need a further upgrade to 'the level'! The bed was very comfy! The pool area looked nice but you'd have to be crazy to swim in an outdoor pool in January. I was disappointed the you had to pay €20 to use the spa facilities - as a guest it wouldn't be unreasonable to expect at least one free visit when your paying the price you are! The bar prices are extortionate so we only had a few drinks here. The selection a breakfast was plentiful and the waiters were helpful. All in all, not bad but would expect better - we wouldn't go back though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Weak on Service”
Reviews.Author: psuirish2003
Reviews.Content: The hotel was solid, but not spectacular. It's location was much farther from the city center than I anticipated, but an 8-min cab ride gets you there. It's a long walk from the city beaches, but doable. Our biggest disappointment was the service and staff. Just seemed like a pretentious group that we were never good enough for. We tried having drinks on the open-air bar halfway up the building, but the bartender was caught up with something else and didn't give us the time. We almost went back to the Hotel Gran la Florida for our last night in town (we spent a few nights at each) but had already paid for our full stay. Again, solid, not spectacular, and serive could be better. Also, definitely trends toward a younger crowd (of which we are as well).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Ashil18
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a very modern interiors. The rooms and the view is simply awesome. The Swimming pool and the lounges were simply the best. The staff is more than co-operative. A must stay when you visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, great staff but not at the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: verypicky_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice, chic lobby. It also has a decent breakfast buffet (included in your stay generally). The bar, restaurants, pool lounge area are nice. The gym is pretty nicely equipped. The staff here is great -- I dealt with the manager about a few issues, and she was very professional and competent. TIP: The rooms are small -- I would definitely recommend getting an upgrade as the standard room is only ok. The upgraded rooms are much better -- on higher floors, better views and a little more room to move around. The main drawback to this hotel is its location. It is NOT at the center of the Barcelona. Instead, it is about a 5 min. walk + 10 min. metro ride away from downtown. To take the metro is fairly simple but you have to learn how to use the different tickets, lines. Cabs are also nearby and don't cost too much. The hotel is not located near nice restaurants/shops, therefore there isn't much to do aside from go to downtown Barcelona everyday. You should be aware of this before booking. It is a reasonably priced hotel, but the (1) size of the rooms and (2) location of the hotel should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “D E S A S T E R !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: D J
Reviews.Content: The stay was a GREAT disappointment. On Saturday 31th December I stayed without electricity for 4 hrs and on Sunday (1st January!) again there were no electricity whereby in addition at 9:00 (NINE IN THE MORNING!) some “construction works” (heavy hammerings) lasted for 2 hours starting at aprox. 10:00 am!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! There were construction works on a 1st of january at 9:00 in the morning!!!! There were no single excuse message or similar form the hotel management, and when checking out, I had to face an extremely arrogant and unfriendly employee just saying that she doesn't care for the serious inconveniences that occurred. IT WAS A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT! Unbelievable. I've never experience such a lack of interest and respect for a guest/client. ME? - never again!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with 0 star service”
Reviews.Author: OFranco11
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at hotel ME Barcelona expecting to have a relaxing holiday only to find service below the standards of a 1 star hotel. On the first night we were not allowed to sit and dine at the hotel's restaurant even though there were plenty of free tables because according to the Manager the waiters were busy. We were told to come back in 15 minutes only to hear the same answer and ended up having to leave and dine elsewhere. Second night the air conditioning doesn't work, after calling several times, someone came and said that it was fixed but the room is still 26 degrees and the air conditioning still doesn't work. Only solution offered was to move to another room for a couple of hours to sleep and that will be called once the problem is fixed...but it is 1:20 am!!! Avoid if possible!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: NFUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent - rooms were comfortable with spectacular views, the ground-floor restaurant was also good (I recommend the lamb shank) and eating amidst enormous coloured glass panels was quite an experience. Staff were always attentive, especially in helping to contact embassy etc when we were pickpocketed and lost a passport and €500 before even getting to the hotel. My companion had to spend a day flying to his consulate in Madrid and back to get an emergency passport. Subsequent web research showed such crime to be a serious problem in this town. Verdict: great hotel but avoid Barcelona until the police has acknowledged and acted on the crime problem.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star in Europe...different from the United States!”
Reviews.Author: Timothy K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in ME Barcelona purchased through a group-based business. We stayed on the ocean side and enjoyed the amenities that the hotel had to offer, while still having time to enjoy all the city had to offer, too. ME is listed as a five star hotel. Though I have never been in one in the United States, I felt like I got a service that was a little different than what a five star would be in the US. That is not to say that the service was bad... The people were excellent! Most of the staff was knowledgeable about the ways of the city, and the breakfast buffet had a diverse blend of foods, some comfortable American cuisine, others a little beyond my scope of knowledge. I recommend the shaved salt pork, or whatever the spanish cuisine was. Location was a tad inconvenient, not close to the real touristy areas, but in a nice enough neighborhood. A ten minute walk to the beach made it worth the while. Room service was good, the rooms themselves were small, but the design flowed well, and the motorized curtain that withdrew to show the wall to wall window made the cost of the room worth the while. Would I recommend it? Absolutely! But, if you are a budget traveler, be prepared to bone up on some Spanish, and maybe do a little research of your own at their 24 hour business center! Check out the front desk for awesome deals for a shopping bus to La Roca Villages...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline P
Reviews.Content: The Hotel ME sets the pace from the moment you enter the lobby. The staff are very friendly, speak multiple languages and are happy to help. Our room was pretty much at the top of the building which had an amazing view of the city. The room itself was lovely, very spacious and really well appointed. The hotel was located slightly out of the centre but it is a no hassle 10 minute taxi ride, and there is a plentiful supply of taxis outside the hotel or the concierge will organise one for you. The beautiful Barcelona beach is a quiet and relaxing 10 minute walk through a residential area. However if you want to stay in the hotel don't worry because you can find everything you want in the hotel itself. The pool area is fantastic whether it be for a swim or to lie in the sun and chill. The bar by the pool is a very relazed affair and serves food during the day. On the day we checked out of the hotel we spent the whole afternoon there which, with the DJ adding to the atmosphere, was a perfect environment for some perfect ME time for anyone couples, families or singles. At night time the pool area becomes a club which is very busy even at 4am, although if this is not for you, you can be assured that the room provides all the silence you need for a good nights sleep. The main bar in the lobby is gorgeous and great for a drink before you venture out. Whilst we didn't try the restaurant it did look fantastic and was always busy with non residents which has to be a good sign. In summary if you are lucky enough to go to Barcelona the Hotel ME provides everything you could want. It matches what Barcelona is all about.

Reviews.Title: “am i the only one that didn't mind the location?”
Reviews.Author: missi96
Reviews.Content: as a new yorker, i didn't mind the walk to get back "home" each night where it was much quieter than staying in the city center - and the hotel rates were much more reasonable as well. however, if you need a siesta in the middle of the day, the location will be an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the edge of the city”
Reviews.Author: Luca_Luo
Reviews.Content: I get this hotel from the bidding in priceline, so the price is quite low for a 5* hotel. We're on the 19th floor. The room is modern with flat TV, wifi, fancy light control system, automatic curtain and IPOD dock. The bathroom is nicely designed but there's no tube in the room. I like the big window in the room but our room is just beside the construction site and we didn't have a nice view. We can see neither the sea nor the Sagrada familia, which is a pity. Also the sound proof is not that satisfy. We can clearly hear the house keeping noises at 9 A.M. in our neighbour room. (maybe you can say that I'm getting up too late...) The hotel is in the edge of the city. The nearest metro station is Poblenou which is about 10 minutes walk. Taxi will cost 6 - 8 EUR to the center of the city. We booked the shuttle bus service to / from the airport from the hotel's website. It's 20 EUR for 2 people in a shared shuttle bus. I highly recommend this service if you come to this hotel from the airport with luggage. The driver is punctual and friendly. There's a petro station beside the hotel with a small convenient shop where you can buy water or snacks. Don't miss the Rambla of Poblenou which is 10 minutes walk from the hotel. It's a nice walking street with a lot of restaurants and bars. Food is nice there.

Reviews.Title: “Location not great”
Reviews.Author: E Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated 10mins (taxi ride) from the city centre and although there is a metro nearby but it takes longer on the metro... we booked the hotel because it had a special promotion, but if we had known it is quiet outside of the centre, we wouldn't have stayed here. The room is rather small and the heating doesn't work. And the lighting in the room poor as very dark even switching on all the lights in the bedroom! However, the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is located way out and the hotel rooms are not 5* !!”
Reviews.Author: amma1234
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to either catch taxis everyday or the local metro! The bedrooms were very small,there was no bath tub, dressing gowns and just didn't feel like a 5 star hotel. Prices on the room service were ridiculous so didn't even bother. Was looking to use the swimming pool and spa services but there were out of service for the full four days we were there! Not happy at all. Staff were nice n friendly but not at all informative of the hotel facilities, tourist or local information. Very disappointed to say it was meant to be a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fashion & trendy”
Reviews.Author: andree p
Reviews.Content: ME Barcelona has it all, from the moment you enter to the lobby you can feel a very special Aura, with modern music and bar in the lobby, this hotel is really worth it. the rooms have all kind of service starting from FREE WIFI to pay T.V., 24hrs Room service, Ipod dock and more. if you dont want to go out to of the hotel dont worry because you can find everything there, the have a club (Angels & Kings) with great parties, SPA, 24 hrs gym, 1 michelin star restaurant, I was there there with my friends and my girlfriend , and I actually booked a romance package. really good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cauliflowertikka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in April to celebrate a birthday. I got a great rate which I didn't think would get me any special treatment but put a comment in the registration that we would be coming to celebrate the birthday. When we arrived in the hotel, there was a kind note wishing us an enjoyable stay and wishing my spouse a happy birthday. Later that night, a bottle of Cava arrived! Very nice service. The hotel is a bit outside the city but it is a short tram or subway ride away to pretty much everything. The room was nice and the Aveda products were a great touch of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed !”
Reviews.Author: Ompile
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 people, stayed 3 nights in the hotel and liked it very much. The design is design but still very functional in the rooms (the only comment : I never saw a 5stars hotel worlwide without toilet brush...). Unlike other reviewers nothing to complain about the service (but we did not eat at the restaurant, there are so many other places in Barcelona to eat , and cheaper!). Cocktail prices at the bar are quite high (10Euro for a mojito) compared to other bars in Barcelona but this is normal price for this hotel standing. Breakfast was very good with spanish specialities like ham and cheese, delicious. Beach is at 10minutes walk, next metro station also, coming back from center at night with taxi will cost you around 20euro. Special big up to the nice receptionnists who were kind all the time and always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: Kamran Q
Reviews.Content: We had a conference in hotel. The hotel is not ready to host an int conference. The room equipment is very poor. In many rooms the shower door was missing. Room is very small. Sleepers are missing. Food is compared too expensive. Area is like Berlin-neukoelln.

Reviews.Title: “Unique place to chill”
Reviews.Author: UnderBigHill
Reviews.Content: Hotel ME located at a nice neighbourhood where it's within walking distance to beach and shopping area. I love my room as it comes with great sea view. I can even enjoy sunrise in my room :) The bathroom is not really spacious but I love the rain shower and bathtub. Oh, and I love the coffee maker too. I enjoy having a nice cup of coffee every morning to start my day, and to have a nice cup of coffee after a long day walk. The buffet breakfast is very good. A lot of variety to choose from, and you can eigher have your breakfast in the unique design restaurant, or at the outdoor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every moment of our stay there!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingNut1972
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel has a unique design and it was planned, designed and decorated excellently. It was a very comfortable stay. But I must agree with the other reviewers that the ME Barcelona can definitely do better at its service. One evening we ate the restaurant and it took for ever to order, to get the food and even to get the check! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Second and last time”
Reviews.Author: Darya R
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this hotel, first time in July and second time this week end and we won't come back. In July we noticed that the service was poor and not at the level of the 5 stars hotel. But the hotel was beautiful and well situated, so we decided to come back. Actually, we had several problems in July and even more this week end( October). In July we stayed at 13th floor and the water was awfully cold all the time, it was impossible to take a shower, I'm not even talking about the bath. The water in the swimming pool was cold too, but when it is hot, it's not such a big problem. The room service took 3 hours. Once we could not enter the swimming pool floor because of the so called private party, we just did not understand why we cannot use the amenities we pay for. As it wAs indicated by someone, there are a lot of strange girls in the lobbies ( we even thought they were prostitutes because of their outfit). But we lved the design of the hotel and it's situation not far from the sea and far from las ramblas. So, we come back in October. As for the first time we came with a little dog of two kilos. It is important to highlight that in July we did not have any problem because of the dog. At the same time they charge the dog's stay 50 euros a day, so, normally there should not be any problems. But this time, while having our breakfast the second day of our stay, we were aggressively told to go out to eat on the terrass with our dog (the first day nobody told us nothing). When I told the manager, that we are staying for the second time and the previous time we could eat with our dog, he said that it was a mistake (a mistake which lasted 4 days however). And he also told me in a very aggressive manner that I should be happy that they accept my dog. He probably forgot that it costed 50 euros (It's the first hotel where we were obliged to pay a supplement for the dog ). I would not bother you with details, I just want to conclude that this is not a dog friendly hotel, not a 5 star hotel and I certainly chose somewhere else to stay in Barcelona NeXT Time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona and we LOVED this hotel. We stayed on the Level, and the service and rooms were great. Your on the higher floors with the Level, and we had sea views that were beautiful. Food and alcoholic drinks served all day, and the staff cannot do enough for you. Love how modern this hotel is, along with the motorized curtains, great lighting and modern rooms and bathrooms. Love that there is no carpet on the floors of the rooms as then there are no grimey, nasty carpet under your feet, just the clean white floors. We always stay in the more residential parts of town when we are on holiday, as we hate being slap bang in the middle of the touristy restaurants etc., This was a great decision in Barcelona. There is a street 2 blocks away full of local bars and restaurants....so much better than Las Ramblas. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussietourist01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night pre-cruise on 24th September. We deliberately chose to stay out of the city centre as we had a 25 hr flight and wanted to stay somewhere quiet. We arrived at 9am with two exhausted teenagers and the staff could not have done more to assist us. They allowed the kids to stretch out and sleep on the sofas in the main reception area (very comfortable ones!) while they prepared rooms for us-which only took an hour and a half-exceptional given they were almost full and check out is not until 12.oopm. The concierge was extremely helpful in giving us general tourist information and directions. We ate dinner in the ground flooe reatuarant and it was delicious and reasonably priced and again the staff were very friendly and helpful. It's only a short-10 minute walk to the beach and numerous cafes at Pobleu Nou.Trams and buses run from outside the front of the hotel into the city centre and it takes around 15 mins on each. We were lucky to get a great rate for our night's stay -$165 Au and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Its just ok”
Reviews.Author: vacati0nnati0n
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean and offers many of the amenities found in a five star resort at a tremendous rate. They have a stunning patio, we sat in the patio alone in the evening paying $12 for a glass of wine. It falls short in a poor location outside the city center(Santi Marti area on some maps). The rooms are unique but small. Phone services are contracted out and a local call is the same rate as an international one. Rates can vary from 170-200+ euros/ night. There are much better finds out there closer to the city center. If you go, ask for a room away from the daily construction.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but poor value”
Reviews.Author: JohnEric2
Reviews.Content: A very stylish, chic designer hotel. Young friendly motivated staff who are over-trained and working to a formula. Location ok but not the best, food ok but expensive. Anyone who knows Barcelona will tell you the smaller restaurants down the myriad of alleys serve inexpensive but fantastic food. The smaller hotels around the Ramblas are not as chic but at least you’re in where the action is without a long trip in and out. Don't get me wrong from the motorised curtains to the designers styling of the bathroom this is a classy hotel. It just is too clinical, too cold for a fabulous city like Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Funky option, but parental guidance suggested!”
Reviews.Author: americantravelgirl
Reviews.Content: My company held a conference at this hotel. The rooms are interesting... White floors in the room that are scuffed - black would have been a better option as white shows ALL the dirt and marks. The bathroom has a window onto the bedroom, so if you are with a partner and shy this could be awkward (I was by myself). The bed was comfortable. The mini-bar item includes a bag of sex accessories - feather tickler, condoms, lubricant, and something called a "vibrating ring". There are lots of hard to see, complicated buttons on the wall to operate mood lighting and curtains. The room key features a sexy looking couple who look like they will be getting it on just now. The internet access home page features an even sexier couple, with a man I would be frightened to meet. The turn-down amenity is a heart-shaped lollipop. I think you get the picture. This is not a family hotel. I would say that it's not really a business hotel, except that all the sex toys, lollipops, dirty internet and room key people made for very lively dinner conversation after a few glasses of wine. If you are up for all this and the price is right, it's a nice enough choice.

Reviews.Title: “Real Five Star Feeling”
Reviews.Author: Szenti
Reviews.Content: Top Hotel, Nice design, clean rooms, very clean bathroom, acceptable fitness Also iPhone dock, full extra room, automated curtains

Reviews.Title: “It's more like a three star”
Reviews.Author: AdanaGlos
Reviews.Content: Ok if your looking for a late night (it has a nightclub). Beds are comfy. Food is ok. The spa was smelly & cold. 20 mins - 30 mins away from anything e.g beach, shopping & sightseeing. View from the rooms aren't good.

Reviews.Title: “Alot of walking!”
Reviews.Author: JJCChicagoSuburbs
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, and unlike Madrid most folks spoke pretty good english. Great pool area! The draw back from the room was we had a crane right in front of our window view. Ask to see the room!!! The staff was very good and friendly. With the exeption of one gentleman at the desk who was helping us book an excursion and was to leave the booked info in our room and also leave info on another excursion we requested. We were there only 4 nights so each day we had to plan to the fullest. We got back to our room late the evening before we were to depart at 8:30 AM for our trip to Monseratt. To our dissappointment nothing was in our room and when my husband went down to the front desk they know nothing about this and he was not there. So we were unable to go and this ruined our last 2 days because we did not have time. The person, which I wish I could remember his name did not even apologize, he said oh I had the wrong room number. Even though he wrote it all down, did not say or do anything other than say well you can do something else. Also, cool neighborhood, but you have to train or bus to get to the popular sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with top service”
Reviews.Author: M1DLD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on business in September. The hotel is an impressive building inside and out. Very modern. I stayed on the 29th floor with a city view that was nothing short of stunning! The rooms are not big but are plenty big enough for two. Very modern and maybe a little to so, with buttons to operate everything so take time to figure them out. The one thing that makes this hotel stand out from the crowd is the staffs attitude to service. The tagline is 'anything is possible' and they certainly do anything to make this a reality. Just call them and within minutes they are there. Overall a nice place to stay with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Me”
Reviews.Author: Ekoi
Reviews.Content: ME Barcelona by Melia is a wonderful 4 star hotel with exquisite service. I have rarely encountered such a welcoming staff. You feel right at home as you step into this modern hotel. The decoration and architecture reflects the new Barcelona. Do not expect plush rugs and carpet. Everything is sober and bright and clean. The airconditioning is so quiet, it is hard to believe it is on. By the night table one can control the whole room. We chose a room with a city view, just to see the lights at night. We were not disappointed. We opted for a Red Level room to enjoy the amenities without much expense: the food and all the drinks are included, all day long in the Level lounge which we enjoyed. This hotel has one of the best restaurants in Barcelona, Dos Cielos. Not to be missed! Although the hotel is not in the center of town, it is just a few euros away by taxi. And for those, like us, who can walk, it is just 20 minutes away. There are always the bus and the metro which are the best way to get around. The hotel staff will help you in this matter. I definitely recomand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was beautiful! SERVICE ROCKED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CeCe30Chicago
Reviews.Content: What a great location. We LOVED this neighborhood. We walked into a "local" restaurant row similar to Las Ramblas but full of locals. It was delish! We could walk to the beach, easy to public transportation. Graet great place! We were here for our honeymoon and really fell in love with Barcelona. I am very allergic to nuts. The hotel restaurant made me breakfast everyday and made sure there was no contamination. I am so lucky that they were that kind. Food variety was def very European; remember you are in Europe. I loved it. ould go back. Drink prices were on the expensive side however I am sure that the cost to run that hotel is high. I'd go back in a split second.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love with ME and are hooked....”
Reviews.Author: RajuWatts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the ME for our 10th Wedding Anniversary and from the moment we arrived until the moment we left , we were made to feel so special and made our weekend one to remember. We were allocated the fantastic Samara to look after us and she was amazing helpful, polite and just a really lovely person. The last time we were treated like this ironically was on our Honeymoon in the Rangali Hilton in 2001. They had arranged the room very specially for me, had our wedding song playing when we walked in, Champagne on ice , rose petals in the room, loads of candles and a message I asked them to put on a note but in fact wrote on the massive mirrored bathroom wall. We had the Loft Suite on the 27th floor and the view was spectacular to say the least, with the Segrada Familla to the left of the view and the gherkin to the right, wall to ceiling windows, a truly special view and room. We were on the levels so had access to the lounge on the 25th floor with free food and drinks all day and service beyond the call of duty, they all just couldn't do enough for us, the knew why we were staying, and basically pampered us for 3 days. A Special mention to Andree and Daniel (both from Mexico) who was really informative and helpful. Location wise it is an 8€ taxi ride to the Ramblas, Port, Barrie Gotic but far enough away to be able to relax. On the Sunday we stayed by the pool all afternoon listening to sun kissed anthems whilst drinking cocktails and eating the free chocolate strawberries! I have been bitten by the "ME" bug and will definately visit them again and would love for our children to enjoy ! What you'll notice is that the air-com pumps out a fruity berry smell and also every candle in the hotel has this smell and when you return home everything including the suitcase smelt of these berries, reminding us of what a great hotel it was and wonderful weekend. Another special mention to the Aura Manager Claire Jones who helped me arrange everything from the luxury of my desk at work, i never envisiged that ME would be this good and I cannot wait until we can come again... 10/10 from "ME"

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance!”
Reviews.Author: KirstyandTom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to the Metro so it's easy to get around. But, the decor is VERY tired, the black paint may have looked great when it was done, but it is in serious need of a refresh. Combine this with the dusty surfaces and the overall effect is eugh rather than wow. The greeting when you check in is seriously lacking -, the staff seem to be totally bored with the whole experience and it shows. Beware that some rooms allow smokers - if you don't specifically specify non-smoking, you may end up in a room smelling like a stale ashtray with no window to open. If the hotel is full, you'll be stuck. It's also worth noting that the design of the hotel incorporates metalwork outside, from the inside this blocks the views from one of the windows. This is a real shame as the views from the higher floors are fabulous. The pool area is great, it's designed to be high impact "hip an cool" in design and delivers. Its also very small so you end up crammed in like sardines, so get there early and don't vacate your spot or you'll lose it! These things aren't deal breakers, but if you're expecting a 5* something special experience it's not to be found here. All in all, it's an acceptable place to stay if you manage to get a cheap deal. If you're having to pay full price and are looking for something a bit special, you may be disappointed. We were.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyNYC
Reviews.Content: I came back last night from an 8 day stay at the Me Barcelona. I had a fantastic experience. The room was lovely and the view of the city from the floor to ceiling windows was so good that I had the curtains pulled back even at night. I fell asleep looking at the lights of the city. The front desk staff were absolutely terrific. They were knowledgeable and friendly. When I asked for help to set up my net book, someone came up with me to my room and took care of everything immediately. The buffet breakfast was excellent. There was a huge variety of choices and everything was fresh and appetizing. I wish I took down the names of the people at the front desk to thank each of them individually. There were plenty of restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel and the one time I ordered room service, the food was excellent. It says I should write also about what I liked least and I cannot think of one thing. The Hotel Me Barcelona made my stay in Barcelona a 5 star experience. I have to add one thing--I travel alone and service is especially important to me. I read some of the other reviews and saw some of the criticisms. I find it interesting that none of those complaints were true for me. I am looking forward to staying at another Me Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Julia J
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to barcelona in the fall of last yr and stayed at ME. Upon arrival, my impression of ME was that it was very modern (like the W) and very well presented. The staff was pleasant and very helpful (we arrived before the recommended check in time). We waited at the hotel lobby bar while the room was being prepared and was prompted to our room as soon as it was ready. The room was small but well designed and very clean. Another plus in my book for this hotel was that they had aveda products! which I love. The bathroom was super interested with a really big shower stall with a sliding door and the toilet in another corner with another sliding door and the bathroom sink situated just behind the bed separated by a big glass window. all in all this was probably one of the most interesting rooms I've stayed at. The breakfast buffet was great and delicious. The hotel lobby restaurant was also very good. The pool and the patio of the hotel was amazing. I was so sad I didn't bring a swimsuit because this patio was awesome! I also ate the best club sandwich at this hotel pool patio. the location of the hotel was not bad, we couldn't walk to anything we wanted to check out but it was a short cab ride to la ramblas, gaudi park and the gaudi church. there were many restaurants and bars in the hotel neighborhood and also there was a very nice large outdoor concept mall near the hotel (walking distance) All in all I enjoyed my stay at ME barcelona and I am a fan of ME hotels now!

Reviews.Title: “MELIA ANSWER TO W HOTELS...”
Reviews.Author: bvansante
Reviews.Content: Although being a Gold member in the mas rewards programm this was my first stay at a Me hotel. It seems to me like the Melia answer to the W hotels/Starwood. A trendy lobby nicely decorated but there it stopped with the pro's At check in at 1pm is was told in a very rude way to come back after 3pm as there was no room available, despite mas gold members can check in from 10 am (subject to availability). After waiting 15 minutes and seeing other people checking in i asked at the reception staff again and was offered a twin room iso the booked double/king. As we did not wanted to spend more time waiting we accepted this room. The room it self was small but nicely decorated with some nice touches. however the room was not very practical eg bathroom/toilet layout. The breakfsast included in our rate was ok but room lacked atmosphere and nothing really specatacular. on offer eg no fresh juice etc. staff worked very unorganised.the pool was very small and not really appealing. we ended up on the beach a 15 minute walk. the area is not very attractive either.all in all would not return to this hotel. offcourse late check out was denied and still did not get mas miles on my account. This hotel needs to get its acts together , especially the staff beecause just a trendy lobby with lounge music is not enough

Reviews.Title: “Service of a 3-star hotel at best!”
Reviews.Author: Lior111
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi from the airport and there were no bellboys to help with the luggage. When we commented the receptionist answered, "we are full sir, wait your turn". I already got the feeling. I requested one of our 2 rooms to have a bath tub, the reply was "fine come back at 3pm". We were at the time 11am. When we came back we were told "sorry its not possible". After I insisted they said ok but it will cost moreand we had to wait 2 more hours. Needless to say, we wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further tha ME Barcelona - Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Ash and Gem B
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I went to Barcelona to celebrate her 30th Birthday. As usual there was much deliberation as to which hotel to book but if we can be of some assistance, look no further, this hotel will exceed all of your expectations. We arrived earlier than check-in and were greated with our first encounter of the staffs "anything is possible attitude" and shown shortly to our lovely room on the 20th floor with views over the lovely roof terrace swimming pool area on the 6th and the ocean in the distance. I had contacted the hotel prior to arriving advising them that this was a special occassion and there was a note written on the bathroom mirror both welcoming and congratulating us. This was the first of many a "nice touch". Others included fruit platters, chocolate dipped strawberries and fantastic music by the poolside. In terms of the hotels situation, in our opinion, it was the perfect distance between the midle of the city (Las Ramblas and Gothic Quarter etc) and the beach. Barcelona in August is an exceptionally busy place so it was nice to retire to the sanctitude of our ME. We will not spoil anymore of the surprise but will say that the lobby and pool bars make fantastic cocktails and the ambiance throughout the hotel spot on. We feel it absolutely necessary to commend the work and service standards of Joe-Lee and his anything is possible team....not only did you make two people very happy but secured the life custom of ourselves and hopefully friends too, thank you. Ash & Gem

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mariatollbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME last week. We entered the hotel and were pleasantly surprised the atmosphere was relaxing clean quiet friendly. The front desk staff were more than accomadating and the concierge was available with any questions or concerns. The room was Miami Beach south beach art deco spectac. We loved it clean bright nice lines and so comfortable. The pool was wonderful we did not get a chance to enjoy it but looked great again very comfortable. The area was close to great eateries, beaches, mall near by. City center close by cab or bus, we did both. I give it a 10 and will stay anytime I am in Barcelona really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, trendy, very nice food, but lots of comments...”
Reviews.Author: slowlyraoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for work, host decided for me. Fancy, trendy, cool, great concept, excellent breakfast. But also: cigarette burn stains on the floor, lamps not working, furniture looking as if it was badly assembled, a mistake by room service, ... Maybe I was just unlucky and this room may have been an exception, but this could have been a truly fantastic experience if it wasn't for a few too many operational mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Hilton954
Reviews.Content: We loved the ME. The location was perfect - a short walk to the metro and tram, as well as the delightful Rambla del Poblenou where we ate most of our meals for a fraction of the price we would have paid downtown. I prefer staying in this neighborhood, which is mainly residential and quieter than in the city center. The hotel has a nice funky feel, the rooms are not as small as I expected and the pool deck is great. Free internet is always a plus. The iPod dock and remote control lights and curtains were all nice extras. Beautiful bathrooms. Staff were extremely friendly and obliging. Our only criticism is the fact that the rooms have very little closet space and drawers, so we had to keep some of our clothes in our suitcases. Would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, loved Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Dan V
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked the hotel ME for short break in Barcelona, flights with ryanair flying into Giona airport. Firstly (although nothing to do with the hotel) Girona airport is not in Barcelona..! anyone expecting a short taxi to the city maybe shocked when the driver tells you its 120 euros ! Girona is actually around 100 km north of Barcelona ! Best bet is a taxi to Girona train station (15-20 euros), train to Barcelona-Passige de Gracia (20 euros), yellow metro from Passige de Gracia to Poblenou (1.45 euros each). All in all takes about an 1hr 20mins and the hotels about 10 mins walk north of Poblenou metro station. Anyway, the hotel is in a district called 22@ which is a nice area to the west of Barcelona city centre. This turned out to be a real plus as we felt we saw more of Barca than we would have had we stayed in the city centre. The area felt safe and clean and had a few good restaurants and cafes for lunch or breakfast. The best way into town from the hotel is via metro, Poblenou station has the yellow line which goes via all the best spots in barca. We particularly liked Port de Olympica and Barceloneta best at night, and all the touristy stuff in the day (la ramblas, passiege de gracia for shopping, parc guell and sagrada familia cathedral etc). The hotel is a 29 story high rise building and is quite striking from the ground. when we arrved the lady on reception was really friendly and helped us with directions and gave us some recomendations etc. we actually ended up agreeing with pretty much everything she said! The hotel It has a roof top pool on the 6th flr with a bar, sunbeds and little booths to sleep and relax in. word of warning, the cocktails will blow your head off and cost about 10 euros each!! we didnt use the restaurants although we heard they were supposed to be good. All in all this hotel is a really good choice, we had an amazing time and although its a little out of town we actually found this to be a real positive! Lastly - if you decide to use the "love me tender" pack they provide..FYI - ITS NOT COMPLIMENTRY, ITS ACTUALLY 30 euroes !!!!!!! total rip off for whats inside (trust me)..

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kate V
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed at ME Barcelona and we spent some days in this beautiful city and we had a an amazing stay. The views from the rooms were beautiful overlooking the sea and the staff was superb and very attentive. The location is better than the W or the Arts. It is not right at the city center but it is 4 blocks away walking distance from the beach and you can go to La Sagrada Familia even walking, the metro is right behind the hotel. We discovered the area and it is beatiful, specially if you go to la Rambla del Poblenou with amazing tapas bars and beautiful architecture. The atmosphere, the pool, the restaurants and bars were all excellent. We will definetely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel ... brilliant attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: blondie3000
Reviews.Content: i have just got back from my hotel stay for my 30th Birthday - the hotel was amazing the staff superb and the dinner at Dos Cielos was the best i have ever had in reference to some other comments i have stayed in 5 start hotels all around the world and definatly class this as one - the level lounge was a great lil extra and my room was fantatstic - the location was good as i wanted to be away from the rable of the Rambals - we were a 5 min walk to the metro 5 stops from the tourist center and a 15-20 min walk to the beach and the clubs there - the aura team are fab could not do more for us and i can not recomend more highly excited to see the London version soon

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good hotel, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Rogers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a week as a 50th birthday treat for my wife. We got a very good deal on an Easyjet flight and a room on "The Level" with lastminute.com. My overall impression is that Me Barcelona ranks as a good 4*, but not a 5*, hotel. However, the price we paid was extrremely fair so this should not be seen as a complaint. The location is about 3 miles NE of the city centre, but there are very good bus routes (7, 40, 42) which take you to the centre in about 15-20 mins depending on traffic. The 40 is particularly useful as it goes to the Port Vell harbour as well as the back of El Corte Ingles in the centre which is great for shopping plus a stroll down the Ramblas. The T4 tram stops right outside the hotel which works well for the Olympic harbour / Estacio de Franca in one direction, and St Adria Renfe rail station in the other which connects to Costa Maresme beaches. Barcelona's public transport is possibly the best in Europe. There is a useful shopping centre at Glories 10 minutes walk up Diagonal Mar which includes Spanish chain stores and a Carrefour hypermarket. The local city beaches are 15-20 minutes walk away down the Rambla de Poble Nou which is a really nice walk along a local tree-lined shopping street with locals out for coffee/lunch/dinner at numerous street cafes with few tourists about. There is a Mercadona supermarket along this street about 5 mins from the hotel which is useful for mineral water, picnic items etc. The hotel itself had a good atmosphere with lots of young intelligent student intern staff only too pleased to help, and to practise their English! The balance between this group and more experienced staff felt not quite right, but should not be viewed as a problem unless you are really particular about a certain type of service. Our room was small but intimate. Room servicing was below the standard expected. We had to request a toilet clean on arrival, replacement of coffee / soap / shower gel several times, and our requested daily newspaper was a bit "hit & miss". Minbar items should be avoided as prices are extortionate. Don't even think about opening the surprise box on top of the fridge! I would recommend a room on "The Level". The Level lounge was another place aside from the room for comfort & privacy. Drinks and snacks were included and saved a lot of money if we had to pay for everything in the bar.Sometimes there was enough to replace lunch / dinner but not always We had two dinners in the Sky Restaurant on the ground floor (not the more expensive Dos Cielos restaurant|). Service was excellent, especially from the wine waiter, and prices were very reasonable for the quality, even given the poor Pound : Euro exchange rate. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel. Don't expect it to be 5* perfection, but get a good price and you'll have a great stay at a value for money deal.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard”
Reviews.Author: ANicolai
Reviews.Content: The architecture is very interesting with this new hotel by Melia. It is trying very hard to be a 5 star hotel, with all the works, but im not sure they are good enough on the details to give them that. Things are "falling apart" a bit here and there, and they have set a high standard on service for themselves which they are not always able to live up to. We had a jr suite, whc is is very nice and large, and comes with a series of perks; use of a Mini cooper for 3 hours a day (but only 3 hours so we did not take the chance), ipod for the room (did not work), and the minibar was out of order. The executive floor drinks and snacks/breakfast worked indeed, and they where very good at offering help with any questions up there. Our bathroom had a window into the room (all the rooms we saw had this) which you could not blind off, again an example on a designer going off the rails if you ask me. They have two restaurants at the ME: The restaurant on the ground floor was a disappointment; the waiter we had was a complete disaster, and the Crema Catalana dessert, which should be the pride of any Catalan chef, was nothing short of a natural disaster! After exchanging it i think we got something he had bought on the next door gas station! Horriffic. The Dos Cielos on the 24th floor was however FANTASTIC! the Torres bros. where there in person and we had the best al fresco dinner in a long time there. Try the baby goat! Price vs quality is great! Nothing more to say. Its just strange how big difference there are between the 24th and the ground floor! Location wise its best for the beach, 5 - 10 min walk away, straight down. It is also not difficult with the Metro only a few mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing super cool amd relaxing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainP
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed when I got to the hotel as we were welcomed like a celebrity couple. I decided to celebrate our wedding engagement after hearing so many good reviews of this super cool and trendy hotel. We were delighted with the room which was decorated with rose petals and had a bottle of cava waiting for us. The view over the city of Barcelona was amazing and the hotel had many great places to relax including in a lounge which was so cosy and felt like someone's living room.   I am sure that the welcome and hospitaliy with have been just as good had I not informed the hotel of the fact we were celebrating our engagement. Having stayed at the W hotel before I think the ME concept and experience is far superior and more personal.   I highly recommend this hotel for a casual visit or to celebrate a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 5* I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Rhi101
Reviews.Content: Although I had a great time in Barcelona I'm not sure I would stay at ME again.  The location is out of the hustle & bustle in a nice quite area, which felt safe & friendly. Plus it's only a 10 -15 minute walk to the beach. I liked the room and thought it was neatly designed.  However a few (there were more) of the gripes I had included  - The reception staff not being overly helpful, they just said what needed to be said & that was about it. In their defence they did seem busy, so it may be a different story at quieter times. - Our room not being ready when they said it would be & not much of an idea when it might be ready. - The room itself looked like it had been cleaned in a rush. - They didn't clean our room again throughout our stay (but did knock on at 7.30am on our last day to see if it needed cleaning!)  - When we ordered glasses of wine at the roof top pool bar the glass my wine arrived in was not clean. When I pointed this out to the lady serving us (astonished that she had even given me it in the first place) she said it was because they were plastic glasses & had been washed in a dishwasher! She seemed annoyed that I'd asked for a clean glass, which in turn annoyed me.  If this was a 3* or possibly a 4* I might have been less critical, but for me this stay was not 5*

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel; No in room internet business travelers beware”
Reviews.Author: debecet
Reviews.Content: First I will start off with the bad. This does not sound terribly important but in a five star hotel it is UNACCEPTABLE! This hotel does not truly offer in room internet. Because during the day it is so slow it is impossible to get work done without going to the business center. When I asked the front desk about this, they boldface lied (which I initially believed) and blamed it on the internet company. We kept being promised that it should be fixed by the "end of the day". It was not until our third day there that one front desk person FINALLY ADMITTED that their internet is ALWAYS LIKE THAT and that the internet is better at nite because less people use it. i do not appreciate being lied to particularly in a PURPORTED FIVE STAR HOTEL! I booked this hotel for my HONEYMOON through an online booking site. First, when I called to confirm, the front desk staff (after being transfered to two people first) told me although they did not find it on their computer, there should be no problem at check in. Now I was a little concerned that a five star hotel was having trouble access our reservation but ok.... We arrived at 11pm. Reservation still not showing up at the computer. Front desk tells me they need to contact the internet site which they say is not responding. Well after flying from Sevilla to Barcelona after experiencing a two hour delay, i was getting very annoyed at this process. Sensing my annoyance, this pleasant young front desk person said with my confirmation page they will gladly put me in a room although I should check with the front desk in the morning to make sure the hotel finds my prepaid reservation and I don't get charged. Well twice I had to go to the front desk over the next two days to confirm our prepaid reservation, until someone finally admitted that there internet is awful so they cannot confirm with the booking site online (which is the only way they tried up until then) but they finally did over the phone. why in a five star hotel, did they put us through that? I also need to mention the three person line every time we had to go to the front desk! As a previous reviewer mentioned this hotel has potential but has issues with execution. eg-bartender taking literally 10 minutes to prepare each coctail (not good when there's a full bar of people), front desk staff well trained to be smiling but not necessarily knowledgeable about different types of restaurants (high end versus local; spanish vs. other types of cuisine); i should mention the absolute professionalism and courtesy of Luis Miguel (sorry not sure of Miguel); He was honest. apologized profusely because I kept having to confirm our reservation and gave very knowledgeable recommemdations about restaurants and travel tips to outside areas. How he is not working at the W Barcelona I do not know.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in new area 22@ close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: ElaBizz
Reviews.Content: Stayed There for 4 nights. Got an incredible price on priceline ( name your price) of 125$. It was well worth it! From entering the room you can only feel like a princess: all white and fushia decor, blue bathrrom, beautiful view with amazing electric curtains,soft and comfortable bed...I love it! Aveda product in the bathroom a plus. The location is far from the city center (8 euros taxi to plaza Catalunya) but if you don't mind walking there is a metro station at 15 min walk with a huge shopping complex also at the other end a big shopping center ( diagonal center) which connect to the green line of the hop-on-and-off bus. You can then connect to the red line for all tourist attractions. The green line also takes you to port Olympico which has all the clubs and restaurants. You have taxis parked on the side of the building constantly. When leaving make sure you take a business card of the hotel cause most of the taxis did not know this hotel ( new area and confused with the other melia) I did not try the breakfast but instead went to the Pere street to some small cafes. Excellent croissants around the area. Beautiful restaurant on the upper floor with an amazing view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the kindest and most helpful staff I've ever met”
Reviews.Author: SD4000
Reviews.Content: The service and kindness of the ME hotel staff is extraordinary. From reservations to the front desk, everybody is more then happy to help you with your requests. It was a delight to stay at ME Barcelona and I could recommend it to everybody. The room (Seaview) was nice and bright because of the featured from ceiling to bottom windows. The beds were amazing, although I stayed in a room with 2 double beds, (no problem since I was alone) I wouldn't personally choose that when I would be staying there with my partner.

Reviews.Title: “Could not figure out why this is 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: kadels_s
Reviews.Content: A nice and clean modern hotel - that gives it 3 stars. Restaurants and a spa takes it to 4 stars. But there were no special amenities and no outstanding service. The spa was nothing special and the massages were jokes. Finally, the hotel is in the middle of NOWHERE. There is a nice Italian restaurant down the street, but nothing else. Would not stay here again - the price was too high and the location worthless. The dental floss stuck to the shower when we arrived was a nice little bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamer_ukLondon
Reviews.Content: Originally we had a standard double room. It was ok, although a bit shabby, fairly small, and the a/c kept switching itself off. We then upgraded to a room with The Level and a sea view (city view rooms just get a view of a building site, and are a bit smaller). This room was much nicer - bigger, airier, not shabby (except the toilet seat which was not attached properly despite us asking for it to be fixed), and The Level gives you access to a Lounge with free drinks, snacks & breakfast. Drinks at the pool bar (Angels & Kings) are ridiculously expensive, but the water melon cocktails from the downstairs bar are lovely. It's a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro which takes you right into the middle of town quickly. Taxi from the airport is approx 25-35Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! So Modern & trendy”
Reviews.Author: SimieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Such an awesome & trendy hotel! As my husband says : 'Off it's head' Wish we got to stay longer. A surpise or two in our room each day, from lolliops to water to chocolates. Cant wait to get back there

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michaeldm188636
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay and loved every minute of it. Friendly staff, lovely interior, great room and located in a quiet neighbourhood, this hotel has everything you expect from a 5* hotel. Highly recommendable..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Provencelover84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME in Barcelona the night before going on a cruise. We booked it on Hotwire, 5 Stars, close to the beaches. Well, it was not close to the beaches, but that is more Hotwire's fault than the hotel's. The location was ok; we used the metro to get around, the metro stop was just a few minutes walking. We had been in Barcelona previously and were happy to be outside the overrun tourist area. The staff was more than friendly - the porter basically ran after us to make sure we had a map, sent us to a small 'Ramblas' area close to the hotel with lots of restaurants and shops. This 'Ramblas' ended at the beach with wonderfull walking paths, clean bathrooms and exercise equipment on the beach. Unfortunately it was a cloudy and windy day. The water in the outside pool was really cold. I would have loved to lounge on the sun-beds and enjoy the atmosphere. The pool is on the 6th floor and they have big curtained red loungers where you can hang out and have a drink. Well, this will be for another time. The room was very small, but very stylish. If the desk would have fit into my suitcase, I would have tried to pack it. However, I found out, that we like the traditional rooms better - this one had the bathroom and the bedroom seperated by a glass wall. This means that the preson getting up in the night to go to the bathroom will light up the bedroom as well. Also, I travelled with my husband, so we did not have a privacy issue, but I would not like to stay there with anything but a very close friend. Breakfast is great, but costs over 30 Euros. If you join the Melia chain's loyalty club, you get one breakfast for free. And after having passed one night there, I know I will be staying in this chain again. What I did not like: the dark hallways with metal on the walls and black carpet. It felt creepy and not very clean (lots of white fluff from the towels on the black carpet) No slippers in the room: there is a carpet in one part of the room and I cannot step on a hotel carpet without slippers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evelynmonica30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ME during the holidays in December, It was fantastic hotel, We stayed at The Level rooms and it was a great value. It included free breakfast in the morning and free cocktails and appetizers in the evening. There was also a room for our 4 year old to play WII. It is a little out of the tourist path but there is always transportation near by. The restaurants in the hotel really do not cater to children, so on one of the nights we had the front desk find us chinese food, it was very hard as it was the on Christmas Eve when most of the businesses where closed, but they managed to find us an open restaurant that delivered, I would recommend staying at this trendy hotel specially if you can book at The Level.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marielouisegell
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in Barcelona. Fantastic quality and service

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which sets a high expectation yet fails to deliver”
Reviews.Author: Trustingtraveller_8
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I cannot recommend a stay at ME Barcelona. The biggest flaw of this establishment is that the promise an aura experience but fail to deliver in many ways. The hotel is lacking: 1. Room service (beyond the hours of 8am to 11am). That is, basically no room service at all. 2. Privacy. The rooms are small and decorated in a modern fashion, but fail to allow enough space for 2 people to actually enjoy the room. It's enough for sleeping only. 3. Cleanliness. Our sliding shower door was faulty and after 4 days it had not been repaired. The room also had the words "Happy Birthday" on the mirror when we checked in which didn't mean anything to us (not OUR birthday). The words remained on the mirror for the entire week that we stayed there. Poor effort. 4. The spa was never attended in the week that we stayed at ME Barcelona. 5. The service was inconsistent. There was plenty of staff around to say hello when you walked through reception but no one around to take a drink order, seat you at breakfast etc. 6. The pool bar was open for one day of our weeks stay. After that, it was closed. The pool waiter (if you can call him that) failed to provide fresh towels or attend upon us frequently enough to order drinks. We ended up buying our own beers and drinking by the pool because the waiter would visit us once every 2 to 3 hours. Basically, ME Barcelona promises to be an experience so much more than accommodation - but how can it be when it fails to provide anything more than mere basic accomodation?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mikeyc75
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here and would highly recommend staying on The Level. The staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Location was the only slight downside but not a huge problem and it was good to eat outside of the usual tourist haunts. Thanks to the Aura team and in particular one of the doormen who was incredibly helpful in recommending two excellent restaurants. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel, great bar- breakfast, cleaning issue with toilet...”
Reviews.Author: MariaTAthens
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel not in the heart of the town that has a great vibe and stylish interior. The breakfast is outstanding. The reception is kind of slow when checking in and could speak better english. The staff at the restaurant when having breakfast was very helpful and polite. BUT the toilet area was not properly cleaned as there was a sliding door that the cleaners did not clean properly and you could notice dirty urine spots and hair on the floor when the door slided that was not ours from the fist day...till the last we checked out. it was obvious that the did not care to clean that spot EVER!!! Other that that it had a great bar with coctails and parties on Friday and Saturday. If you are young and like a decent hotel to stay this is it. What you pay is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, inventive and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CBtravellerB430
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to barcelona before and this hotel was a wonderfully stylish introduction. The staff were very friendly and gave some very useful recommendations of places to visit. Whilst the room wasn't huge there was an imaginative use of space. Only down side was that the pool wasn't heated.

Reviews.Title: “Me Barcelona-a top experience in Spain”
Reviews.Author: ManoTripAdv
Reviews.Content: I like that hotel. Even though it is not in the most central location, it is much better than most other hotels in Barcelona. Fianlly a big room! And the A/C was working! The night club is one of the best I have been to. It starts at 1am - yes at 1. And it is happening there! Stay in The Level, it is awesome. They have the most attentive staff, and a very nice breakfast buffet set-up. even during the day, they have Tapas on the buffet, and always a cold beer!

Reviews.Title: “The Aura experience which does not live up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: JasonFSydney
Reviews.Content: As a current guest of ME Barcelona i regret to report i am absent of the following; 1) a clock in my room 2) 24 room service 3) decent lighting 4) an informed concierge 5) service by the pool bar is non existent 6) a clean room, had to call 2 times to get rooms made up after 4pm 7) hallways smell of bad odour 8) gym has no fresh water anywhere, new machines that dont work.... 9) a serviced spa, it seemed to be locked every day. Than i found out i need to pay extra for such facilities 10) a shower door that works, i am still waiting for this to be fixed after 3 days. Overall whilst not central the hotel does offer a poolside area to lounge and relax. Its location was not problematic as it close to a metro station. At check-in we were impressed with the check in experience but beyond that every other facility left a lot to be desired. As a frequent traveller who spends up to 100 nights per year in hotels this has to be the worst hotel i have stayed in the past 12 months. I feel the experience is best described as a well thought out concept which is poorly executed. If it not been for prepaying the entire stay i honestly would of checked out after day one and headed to the Le Meridien or another establishment. The only positive aspect of the hotel is DOS CIELOS, this is a wonderful restaurant which i would recommend to any individual wanting a world class experience. If only the Aura team were like the staff at DOS CIELOS.

Reviews.Title: “Me Barcelona,the only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: firefoxLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an extended weekend stay at the 'Me' hotel. This is our 2nd stay there and as before it was perfect. From the staff that make you so wellcome, to the quality of the rooms. This hotel brings service to a higher level. For my next stay I think I'll save up and sample the Michelin star restaurant. Although it could be nearer the centre of Barcelona there is always a taxi available, and the Metro is only 3 mins walk away. If at all possible try and book a room above the 20th floor as this will allow you access to the 'level' --a place where service and quality reach new peaks.

Reviews.Title: “ME Barcelona - Top of the league just like the football team !”
Reviews.Author: unc-j
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a flying visit to Barcelona to visit family and friends. A great excuse to travel at any time but now having had the "ME experience" we are saving the pennies (or cents) at a furious rate so we can head back as soon as possible. The hotel is located just off Avenguda Diagonal, not so far from the "Gherkin" building and was easily reached by airport bus transfer and short taxi ride. First impressions at reception were very good indeed. It is a boutique style hotel and the mood is nicely understated - not pretentious but very welcoming. After a speedy check - in we were shown to our rooms on the 23 rd floor. We were very fortunate to be able to have booked a suite and nothing at all disappointed, from the spectacular views of the city to the high quality furnishings and extras provided. All the electronics are Sony, Philips etc. and the bathroom complimentaries are all high quality brands. The hotel provides just about everything in the room for your stay as standard and anything else is just a phone call to reception away. Our rooms also meant that we had access to the "Level". This is a lounge on the 25 th floor where guests can avail themselves of complimentary beer, wine, spirits and light snacks which are refreshed throughout the day. It's a great place to meet for breakfast or for drinks before you venture out into the city. The hotel restaurant has recently been awarded it's first Michelin star and we met the chef on a tour of the hotel. He took great pleasure in showing us his kitchens which were prepping up for that evenings sittings. And that also sums up the whole attitude of the staff at this hotel. They are all obviously proud of their hotel and the work that they do in there. If they can do anything for you, it is done well and with a lovely manner. Our stay in Barcelona was greatly enhanced by our stay in the ME hotel - I hope yours will be too

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Maximus_107
Reviews.Content: First of all, the check in was extremely friendly and quick. We asked for an early checkin prior to reaching Barcelona and the request was duly obliged. The room was excellent, amazing views of the sea and very spacious and well equipped. We had to ask for an iron and ironing board but that was provided. The location is very good, with a metro station 5-10 min walk away, althought the tram station is virtually outside the entrance. The customer service was second to none and the staff could not do enough to ensure you have a wonderful stay. One of the best hotels we have stayed in. Thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service !”
Reviews.Author: Phillicj
Reviews.Content: Having booked 'Me' we were pleasantly suprised to get an Email offering help to make our forthcoming stay more enjoyable.I replied with a request for a restaurant reservation to Moo(excellent) which was done for us.if we had prepared we would have made other requests(Segways,cycle tours etc) but hey ho! We stayed two nights and each morning as we exited the hotel we were met by Omar who recommended tapas bars and restaurantsy drawing them on a map for us.Excellent customer service from the team but especially Omar and Julie on the 2nd floor!!!

Reviews.Title: “missing that special touch”
Reviews.Author: Michelle186340
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very modern and contempary look from the outside and in. It is located in an urban area primarily used for housing of locals and it is about a ten minute walk from the metro. The decor is new and nice in the lobby and terrace and the room was very modern with stylish features and the latest in lighting technology (a little confusing to use though). The hotel was very clean and comfortable with tv and docking station in room and a good view if your on a high floor. The mini bar is expensive and the breakfast cost €22 each however this can be halved by becoming a member.The staff have about an average attitude towards guests and this is the biggest down floor of this hotel. It is not the type of place that you are made to feel special. Our biggest complaint is that the Spa was out of use for the duration of our stay. We only booked the hotel two days before our stay however we were not informed of this. The Spa was one of the reasons that we booked the hotel so we were very dissapointed. This is where the hotel lacked the special touch.... when we made a complaint about this to the manager we were just offered an apology and told that the massage part was still open (priced at €177 each), we were never offered any sort of good will gesture for this disruption. I have never stayed at a hotel that doesnt offer a good will gesture when something disrupts your stay in this way. We made sure we let the hotel know during our stay so they had the opportunity to put this right however they never did, what more can we say on that matter......

Reviews.Title: “Confused Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOB6198
Reviews.Content: I’m not sure this hotel knows what it wants to be and I believe it ends up being a cool bar/club with some rooms attached. Just stayed over the weekend which we only booked 3 days before flying so where really struggling to get in any the hotels I liked or knew as there was a Rugby European Cup Quarter final being played on the Saturday. 80 thousand Frenchmen had booked the city up!
