Usually stay 5 star when travelling with girlfriends and for this break was looking for a hotel with a nice pool and within easy access to the beaches however took a punt on last minute.com secret room to avoid the high costs for the last room available in the city. Pros: Allowed us to check very early as turned up at 11:30am when first check in should have been 3pm. Very friendly and took us to the room on the 6th floor with view of building site but no big deal as wasn’t here to sit in the room but on the beach or in café bar. Area not anywhere near city centre or on the coast is actually in a nice quiet spot. 10-15 minute walk down one of the long streets to the beach (left hand bay) and on the back streets loads of local style shops and small cafes. Also you can connect to the metro or tourist bus close by. More of local feel and miles from the tourist trap of La Rambla. Note there is another Rambla near to the hotel which is lovely. Easy to find as it’s a very high tower. Cons: Very small room with too much in it. They appeared to have seen some of the good ideas in other hotels and just tried to chuck them all in to a very small space. No larger American would even fit in the toilet, there was a 4 foot long sun bed under the TV so you couldn’t lie on it or sit on. Joint taps in bathroom but no room to pass each other. But most importantly as there was no window or balcony and as neither the fan nor Air Con was working in this tiny room it was reached 27 degrees for most of the time we where in there. I called the reception 4 times about this and also had to call about hot water. It was noticed both worked in a fashion directly after call but never satisfactory. The pool area and sun terrace is a bit of a joke while a good idea in principle there are no good views here and the pool is freezing/tiny while the whole area around it is claustrophobic. Decor while okay downstairs in lobby bar area is pretty horrid on floor level (Bright metal everywhere and bar area looks like the set from a 70’s vampire film. Even after considering I may have got a dud room for booking on the cheap the question would always be would I stay here again? The answer would be I’m afraid be no and this hotel is not a 5 star. There are much better options in Barc still a great city I have visited maybe 6 times.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: foodieswallow
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, not in the best neighbourhood but fairly close to the beach and if you are happy catching taxi's you wouldn't notice any problem. Staff were excellent and eager to attend to our needs, got a fantastic deal on the net and were unexpectedly upgraded when our air con wouldn't work properly. They have a lovely bar on the ground floor and very popular nightclub on the 5th, odd 80's music on Friday and still not sure it wasn't a student night! Saturday the club was very dark and playing great music, also have a swimming pool outside so I bet the parties are great in the summer, despite this I didn't find the noise noticeable anywhere in the hotel. Breakfast was exceptional, one of the best i've seen and I would definately stay here again, i didn't give the hotel the full 5* for everything as there were the odd signs of wear and tear in the rooms but really nothing to be too picky about particulalry if you stay on a special offer!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for those looking for something special”
Reviews.Author: nadeemcrowe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in March - in fact i write this from the room on my final night. Firstly, the area: Contrary to what other reviewers write - this hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Metro Poblenou on the L4 line. It is perfectly connected to central Barcelona, the Barri Gotic and the beach is only 2 stops away. Poblenou (literally New Town); is a beautiful quiet suburb in the 22@ region - here old meets new; old Catalan soul with some amazing local architecture and parks; also the Glories shopping mall only 10 minuted walk. The rooms in this hotel are quality rather than quantity. I have seen bigger but everything is done well from the lovely cashmere bedding to the kitsch desk and wall print. Oh and when it comes to room service, the food is AMAZING :) I am a huge fan of Jamon Iberico and 22 euros got me a very generous portion (Jamon Iberico costs around 95 euros per kilo to buy from the market). The thing that sets this hotel aside from any 5 star hotel I have stayed in is the quality of staff. What amazing amazing people to start each day with. I had a problem with the heating in my room and the team could not do enough for me eventually changing my room all together. The girl on reception Elena showed me to a new room and made sure everything was to my satisfaction. The local knowledge of the staff is also invaluable with loads of advice on what to do and what not to do. Listen; if you want a beautiful hotel with amazing staff close to a metro, the beach and an area of Bacelona unexplored my most tourists. Stay here - I will be staying here again :) Thanks you Hotel ME

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like this style”
Reviews.Author: samer_kz
Reviews.Content: This was a very strange hotel, rooms built to be very economic in the interiors establishment from the walls to the floor, Once the left door was open in the 15th floor where my room was, I found myself in a metal corridor which is typically like a morgue and the rooms from outside like the shelves for dead bodies, inside the room it was very small and everything seemed to be plastic and artificial and made to be economic The bathroom is a real disaster, the toilet is almost in the room, the carpet smells very bad, the lights in the room was not good and the lightening system is complicated. I was not happy during my stay and won't certainly go there again

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Xavier979
Reviews.Content: I've been to Me Barcelona last November for a 3 days business trip. I booked the room via Internet and I got a very interesting offer. The room itself was tiny but with all the comforts I needed for a business trip. Bathroom facilities, lights, Tv, bed, pillows, computer desk , were all ok. The mini bar was filled with excellent drinks and delicious cookies. Room service was flawless at every time of the day and the night. I had breakfast and dinner in the room and the food was always very good. Service staff was always kind and efficient. I got a call after every delivery to ask me if every thing was ok. Room was cleand twice per day plus an evening check before dinner time. I used the Spa once, Jacuzzi and steam bath were ok, only another couple was there so I could enjoy relax. Position (Avenida Diagonal) it's good, not far from the Vila Olimpica. I didn't spend much time in the hotel since it was a business trip, but I really had nothing to complain about, I wasn't looking for luxury but for comfort and good and efficient service. Will definitely be back next time I will travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better!”
Reviews.Author: Koodoowarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ME fir business meeting the for long weekend and found that yes hotel was located quite a but away from the main tourist area but despite bar and night club it was very quiet at night. I agree with the other reviewers that the lighting was poor and difficult to figure out. The furniture was chipped and the overall quality of finish was poor. On the business side the food served a lunchtime was dreadful... One chicken dish was left untouched by all the delegates! On the plus side all staff were very efficient, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: WVE
Reviews.Content: Me is a large hotel in a trendy style. Room 1611 has a distinct designer look. It combines high tech looks with cosy accents. The room is not so very large. There is a nice medium sized pool on an elevated terrace (not used as it was only 2°C) Breakfast was a nice buffet with wide choice and good quality. The reception desk staff was quite friendly and helpful, so don't hesitate to ask for help. The hotel is located along the Avenida Diagonal, with a tram running in front. Though the Avenida Diagonal is a big road, no noise was heard in my room on the 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect New Year get away - peaceful, great service and vibey at night.”
Reviews.Author: LaPage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights over NYE and we had a spectacular stay. We had one of the rooms on the top floors and we were not disappointed. A larger room than we are used to in Spain and beautiful views - you can even see the sea in the distance. The hotel is very modern and cool and trendy. We are in our 30s so this suited us perfectly. As we had one of the better rooms in the hotel you also get access into a lounge in the day time where you can grab a coffee or even a glass of wine free of charge and relax with the panoramic views on the 25th floor. The Level team who look after you are fantastic - so friendly, they spoke excellent English and they really made our stay special. So thanks Alvaro and Fanny! You rock! We also went for lunch in their fabulous Michelin star restaurant with the amazing brothers who are the chefs. The food and wine was amazing - as was the service and the views. Cannot recommend it enough. Not cheap obviously but worth the money. You are lead in through the kitchen and you get to shake hands with the chefs which is very novel and makes you feel very special. The location for the hotel is maybe not ideal - but it is only 6-7 Euros in a cab into the Gothic area and it is only a ten minute walk to the beach or the Port Olympic. The upside of the location is that it is very peaceful at night! And to be honest there is hardly a reason to leave the hotel if you don't want to - as it has everything! I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a vibrant hotel that offers excellent service, a peaceful sleep, but also the possibility of finding a party (as there is a club IN the hotel and a great bar also).

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from this star rating”
Reviews.Author: JCHSA
Reviews.Content: When you arrive after a day of sightseeing at 5:30pm and your room is not yet cleaned... I leave it up to you to decide whether this is your type of hotel. So now you have to wait out in the passage or the foyer for them to clean the room...! (NO we did NOT accidentally leave the "Do not disturb" signs on the door or anything else that could have prevented them from cleaning the room - we were out of the room at 9am) Also have the following comments on the hotel; 1. Rooms on the small side 2. No Tea/Coffee facilities in the room - Room service took 35min to deliver 4 coffees at a cost of around EUR 20 3. No bath - sure the hotel is funcky but a nice bath after a day out is really nice 4. Agree with previous reviewer regarding the light/curtain swithes that can be confusing. I'm in IT and it took me a while to work it out. The curtain slider in our room was out of order. 5. Lighting in the room not suitable for getting any work done. Some people are lucky to go on a work trip or vacation without having to work at night, well I had to and it was very taxing on the eyes. 6. Location is NOT close to La Rambla or Gothic Q as suggested by other reviewers. No quick return to the hotel. Nearest tube station about 3 blocks away. Must say it is nice and quiet. 7. Privacy in bathroom. Guess some guests may find it spectacular - not me. If price is your determining factor, you may enjoy this hotel. Please do not expect old world charm. This is all very modern steel and glass.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosiano
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a former working-class neighborhood very close to the Barrio Gotico. The neighborhood is undergoing transformations with a lot of skyscrapers and nice and modern building. The Me Barcellona is hosted in one of those skyscraper, more than 110m high. The hotel is very modern and pretty posh but feels good and not too pretentious. The tube is 5 min walk away and will take you Downtown in 10 minutes. Arrived there around 12, they upgraded to a better room - 18th floor - but asked us to wait at the Bar. Room was ready and there we go. Very nice seaview and a lot of light - room is very very nice, the bathroom has a glass wall that looks toward the bed and the windows. Staff was nice, breakfast was pretty good as well, maybe not up to a 5 Star hotel par but no complains. Visited the famous lounge bar on the sixth floor but was not impressed - maybe it was too early in the night. The only downside is that I had trouble with the wireless - works fine in the lobby, not so good in the rooms and moreover you are forced to login with a user/password each time on each device (at least on my Apple devices) But you're in Barcelona, so no time to spend Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Cost”
Reviews.Author: GRBean
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the ME Barcelona Hotel for these reasons: 1. Small room (though perhaps not unusually small for a European hotel) 2. No coffee/tea machine 3. No ice bucket 4. Power outage/fluctuations 5. Could not figure out how room lighting works (special button panel with unclear icons/images next to each side of the bed was difficult to interpret) 6. Shower and sink doesn't drain (the basins are not angled enough to drain) 7. Out of city center (though, in its benefit, this does make it quiet and less expensive). The main problem with this is that, since Spaniards don’t eat dinner until 8:30 PM or later, occasionally you may want to return to your hotel to rest before dinner, which is difficult to do when the hotel is away from the attractions). 8. Small window does not take advantage of a nice view. The majority of the potential window space facing the view was wall, and then the wall was covered with curtain. 9. No in-room privacy: large window (without curtain) between bed area and bathroom prevents privacy and interferes with sleep (light in bathroom/shower/closet area is visible in bed area through large window) 10. No ESPN or American CNN (admittedly an “American” bias) On the plus side, the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Hdamiani
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona to meet with my husband that was in Military Pass stationed in Kosovo and had a blast in Barcelona. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are very nice, clean, had everything I needed. The rooms are not very spacious, but I stayed in 3 hotels in Barcelona and non of them had big rooms. Just wanted to tell everyone that Trip Advisor really helped me selecting the hotels to stayed and I made all the correct decisions.

Reviews.Title: “Simply had a great time - lived up to all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: chopette
Reviews.Content: We found the staff incredibly accomodating and helpful (they recommend a fabulous seafood restaurant for our last night there). Rooms were great - we read in a review that you could hear the water in the pipes in your room, which granted you can, but it honestly was not disturbing in the least. If the bed was any more comfortable I would not have seen anything of the city. It is in a very easy location to get into the city - quick walk to the closest tram stop which is incredibly easy to navigate. About 10 - 15 minutes into the heart of the old town. We would stay there again without a problem. We ordered room service on 2 occassions and must admit that the food was not great, but then being room service we didn't expect it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, a little bit off the map”
Reviews.Author: mucben
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel! Breakfast was great. Very modern atmosphere. And a very nice gym and Wellness Spa! I treated my self with a very very relaxing massage. The gym offers modern equipment which I used before running on the beach. The beach is approx. 5-10min run/walk away. Rooms are very well equipped with modern equipment and Ipod docking stations are in room and bathroom as well. Size of the room was not too big, but in Barcelona you should spend your day outside anyways. Prices for Minibar, etc. are outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Birthday celebration stay”
Reviews.Author: Samiloupepperell
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Tesco Travelstore and got a really good deal. Prior to arrival I contacted the hotel to request a bottle of Cava to be waiting in our room on arrival, to celebrate my husband's 40th. I received a few replies and was basically told that a bottel would be waiting on arrival free of charge, a very nice touch! I also requested a price for a room upgrade, but decided against the extrra cost. I had several email conversations with Aura Experience Manager, Claire who I found to be extremely professional and knowledgable. We arrived at 11pm on a Friday night and found check-in to be very smooth, we were allocated a room on the 28th Floor which had stunning views and a lovely bottle of cava waiting for us!! The rooms are fairly compact but are extremely well formed, will exceptionally comfortable beds. The double shower is lovely. We had been upgraded and that meant we had use of the "Level Lounge", which to be honest would be totally worth paying for, I think that their website should maybe advertise the facilities in greater detail, as I'm sure more people would book if they realised that there were quality free drinks and food available there, and of course with it being located on the 25th floor it has stunning views! The hotel is located a fair distance from what would be considered as Barcelona main town, however there are excellent transport links and being as how Barcelona is so flat you can easily walk for miles each day, as we did. Sagrada Familia was less than 30 minutes on foot, La Ramblas maybe 1 hour, the seafront and Port Olimpic again only 15 to 30 minutes. We didn't end up eating at the hotel simply because we were elsewhere at mealtimes but did have a few drinks. We found the staff at the bar to be most welcoming and friendly. In fact we didn't encounter any staff members who weren't 100% polite, professional and helpful. This really is a gem of a hotel and I would recommend it to everyone. We are already thinking about a return visit to Spain, possibly Madrid this time and would most definately look to book the Me Hotel there. When we come back to Barcelona we wil have no hesitation in coming back to ME.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill now”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Gussie
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the ME. As we had already been through the 'blown away, 1st impressions' feeling the previous time we knew what to expect aesthetically. Because of that we were more able to focus on the service this time. Unfortunately it disappointed us. This was an anniversary trip for my wife and I and I had pre-booked a room on The Level to take advantage of the higher rooms and the Lounge area as somewhere to go as a haven during the early evenings. The extra cost was an issue but something I felt was worth it. The problem was that the Lounge was being renovated during August (summer high season no less - why not do it in Nov or Feb?) which would have normally been fine if we had of been told; however we weren't until we checked in. I wasn't particularly happy as I had told my wife we had Level access and we were looking forward to it. I just thought it was sloppy that we weren't told (I would have simply reserved a 'normal' room for less). The problem was that the service issues didn't end there. I had pre-ordered flowers (at a cost of EUR50) to be inside our room on arrival for my wife. I received an email confirmation the day prior to departure assuring me that this was organised. Upon arrival - no flowers. This annoyed me as I wanted it to be a surprise for my wife. Final issue was with the errors around the laundry. As part of The Level you are allowed three articles of clothing laundered on arrival. I had to request this service three separate times from the front desk before it was done - by then the dinner where I needed my shirt had passed. All of these issues were 'remedied' by a free drink or some chocolates, but I feel that a hotel of this quality should be able to get it right the first time. We didn't have these problems the previous years and I can't help but feel that this hotel is going downhill. Barca has a variety of 5-star hotels and I think we'll try somewhere else on our next trip there. As an aside, the food at Dos Cielos upstairs was great. The Sommelier was very friendly and knowledgeable and the view was outstanding. Go there whether you stay here or not. BG

Reviews.Title: “If I could give this hotel a sixth star, I would!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlLuvr85
Reviews.Content: Arriving at this hotel after a luxury cruise was the perfect ending to our summer vacation. We were greeted upon arrival (at our taxi, how impressive!) and the reception staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. It was very obvious that they were happy to have you there and, rightfully so, proud of their city. Every time I called room service or reception, I was greeted with "Hello Mr. Davis, anything is possible! How can I help you?" I thought at first it was just a greeting but the staff really stood by that statement - which included some really weird requests from me after partying long nights in Barcelona! The hotel's location is in walking distance of a lot of the sites we wanted to see - including La Sagrada Familia and the Torre Agbar (the bullet-shaped building). They actually come by to clean the room or see if you needed anything TWICE a day - cleanliness was definitely no issue here. As impressive as the hotel is, you'll be even more amazed by the staff. Everyone of them was engaging and pleasant to speak with. This hotel could definitely teach a lot of hotels about customer service. Standing outside waiting for our taxi, other guests were commenting on how nice the staff was - so it just wasn't our impression, others were equally impressed. This is certainly the only hotel we'll ever stay at in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Young and chic!”
Reviews.Author: livadore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ME with a friend of mine and overall we loved it! The pool deck was AMAZING, very chic and fab, the room was very modern and the hotel itself was very chic. There was a downside though - the service. I've stayed at several five star hotels and this hotel does not have a five-star service at all. At check-in we had to ask for our luggage to be brought up to the room, which is something that shocked me since I never had to ask for the hotel staff to take my luggage. Part of the staff was rude, had bad english while others, especially at the restaurant were amazing and very kind. The hotel location can be an advantage to some and a disadvantage to others. We were a bit afraid it would be too far from the beach but it wasnt! It was just a ten minute walk to the beach and the hotel was situated in the most beautiful area of barcelona - poble nou. It's such a soulful and beautiful area, we prefered it a hundred times over ramblas and the touristic areas of Barcelona. If you want to explore Barcelona, this would'nt really be the place for it since it's not in the touristic areas, but theres a bus that stops right outside the hotel (and metro) that takes you to Las Ramblas in like 15 minutes. Taxi's are fairly cheap - around 8 euro from the hotel to the more central areas. As you would expect from any five-star hotel everything at the hotel in terms of food and drinks is a bit pricey. Water is 5 euros and the club sandwhich (which is great btw) is around 20 euros. There's a gas station like 100 meters from the hotel where you can buy water and there's even a LIDL five minute walk from the hotel. I recommend you to take breakfast at the hotel since it's very yummy. It's not an enormous buffet, but it's fairly large, and there's even champagne at the breakfast! ;D Overall we loved this hotel because of it's chicness and the fact that there's music everywhere is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but lacks the finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: KLHA
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Barcelona, the ME hotel was a lovely place to stay. Asthetically, very cool and hip, with monochrome staff in their black or white attire. The lobby bar has a cool vibe in the evening, with the hotel also being a popular nightspot for it's Kings and Angels bar. Didn't get to experience the spa or pool but it does look lovely, so I'm sure it would be a great place to kick back and chill. The rooms were a good size, clean, with a funky interior. Great views over the city or to the sea if you are above the 7th floor. Our room unfortunately had a few problems, light wouldn't work in the bathroom, and ipod dock wouldn't function either. This should have been easily fixed, however even after asking, and the staff promising to have it fixed or send someone to the room, are constant requests seemed to be ignored. Also, as we arrived late on a friday evening around 11.30, we were hungry and wanted food. Unfortunately the hotel restaurant wasn't open so we had to order room service. The after midnight menu was very limited, and considering it's a 4* hotel, the food presentation left a lot to be desired, and was definitely overpriced. In terms of location, the hotel is in Poble Nou, which seemed to be a quiet area, though it was in walking distance (10 min) walk from the nearest metro station and the local Rambla del Poble Nou, which had a great buzz with shops and restaurants. It is also walking distance from the Sagrada Familia. All in all a great trip in an above average hotel. I just think it could be a superb hotel if a little more attention was paid to certain areas of quality and service. Would go back but it would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LYNJU
Reviews.Content: Very hip, very chic, very happening place to stay. Am from Miami and found the hotel and the decor to be very similar to that of a high end South Beach Hotel. Employess always had a smile and were more than accommodating to our every request and/or need. Highlight of our stay was dinner at the restaurant on top of the hotel, Dos Cielos. Unbelievably fantastic, incredible food and nouvelle cuisine chef. Open kitchen lent an opportunity to watch him and his staff create a meal that will surely be long revered by this foodie. Expensive but well worth the experience. Hotel is out of the hustle and bustle of the Las Ramblas but is only a short, inexpensive cab ride away or you can choose to walk a 15 minute walk. Tall, awesome, modern skyscrapper building, not for the traveller who wants to know they are in Spain while in their room. We thought it was a great chaNge of pace as we were travelling for two weeks and sometimes you need a break from your cultural differences to step back and appreciate both sides. This was the place to do it in complete luxury and attention. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With Suprme Problems”
Reviews.Author: lottemar
Reviews.Content: We (me and my husband ) have been to many hotels all over Europe but I really don't think we will visit this particular one in the future again.We stayed at ME Barcelona between 11/09 to 17/09 during a medical congress my husband had to attend .Our room was viewing the pool and part of the city (it was at the 7th floor) ,but it wasn't the location that mattered at all .The room had only a chair next to the desk and a sofa beside the bed itself . There was no lamp on the desk and the lamp over the sofa didn't work .Also my reading lamp (on my side of the bed ) didn't work .The lighting therefore was very poor for anyone who would like to work or write or read . The only bearable spot to do all that was just ONE SIDE OF THE BED .Beside all this , (and the most annoying ) every time the shower in the room just over our own was used , water was running inside our OWN shower from the ceiling . Shall I mention that TV didn't work ? ( we didn't care about this that much though) .We mentioned the lamps and the shower problem to the concierge ( all of them are very friendly and speak very good english ) and as a result somebody knocked our door once and mentioned the lamps but at that particular time I was resting and couldn't receive him .No second attempt was made after that apparently . To the positive side I will mention that due to a party that would have taken place during our last night at the hotel we were offered a level room (20th floor )to avoid the inconvenience of the noise, where all lamps were working at least and you wouldn't have to fret if your unknown upper level neighbor would think to take his/her shower at the same time as you. Beside that ,breakfast was decent and for all that are kin in modern cold design the hotel is a treat .The area is a disadvantage though , the stench from the sewers was at some points unbearable the minute you stepped outside the hotel gate.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: arg2day
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at the ME Barcelona in early Sept for work. The first impression was nice but I was really impressed once I got up to my suite on the 22nd floor. The room was tricked out with little details that make a difference , my highlight was certainly the Nespresso maker but also the heated towel rack and fully loaded ipod with a great selection of music, showed that great thought went into the ME EXPERIENCE. The highlight for me was the service..I am convinced that the staff was some of the sweetest I have encountered. They remembered my name and I was made to feel special. Thank you to all the staff from the front desk team to the experience managers to the girl at the breakfast who made my stay so memorable. Kind regards, H. Spinner

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. We absolutely loved it.”
Reviews.Author: FredLondonUK
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by charming and helpful Reception staff. Got to our room with an exquisite view over Sagrada Familia and Mount Tibidabo (for us rather this than sea view). Room was greatly designed. The hotel is very interesting indeed. Very design, over the top at times, but never tiring. Wonderful sun sets over Barcelona from our room. Romantic, wonderful. The clientele is an interesting mix, from a young clubbing crowd to older couples. Mainly French and English tourists, as well as Spanish. In terms of location, if you don't mind taking taxis (10-15mins) to city centre you should be fine. The hotel is also close to the beach (5 euros for a taxi). Breakfast is a very pleasant affair, and great staff. Staff is one of the strengths of this hotel, very friendly and pleasant, with only a few with a certain attitude: staff are obviously chosen for their youth and a certain look that matches the hotel ambience, and usually they have the spanish friendliness and charm. Again, only few exceptions to this. Room service quite overpriced and food choices at swimming pool bar quite limited. But for a weekend away they are quite enough. Swimming pool is a very nice area, pleasant and relaxing. Even when full, it is never noisy. Wonderful afternoons there. One thing I would eventually change: club music at breakfast felt a bit too much. But this seems to be the hotel policy, there is music all the time in all public spaces (NEVER loud though).

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonGreggy
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5 night stay at the ME, on our first visit to Barcelona. We chose it mainly because it had a pool area and was near to the beach, as we like to relax as well as go sightseeing. They both served us very well, and the 2 person sofa-beds at the pool were very comfy!. The room was very contemporary, and extremely comfortable. The city view was awesome (we were on the 19th floor) and actually looked better than the seaview as the coast is a 10 minute stroll away. We stayed on a bed & breakfast basis, so we though the breakfast was fine. However, at well over 20 euros a head it would seem expensive unless you use the card scheme mentioned in other reviews. The ME is located on the main Diagonal road, but at the end closest to the sea. Therefore it is a few km's from the city centre. We actually found this a bonus, as Poblenou metro station was only 5 mins walk, and you could be in the city centre within 20 mins. We really liked the Port Vell and Olympic Ports in the evenings, and these are even closer via the Metro. Having looked at hotels in the centre of the city, we are so glad that we chose to stay at the ME. The city has great public transport links to help you get around. We used two 10 trip metro tickets each, which at 7.85 euros are exceptional value. We usually take taxis on our city visits, but we only used them from and to the airport. I would recommend using this hotel, and we'll use it if we go back to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: AliBakes
Reviews.Content: My design / architecture mad hubby and I honeymooned in Barcelona and stayed in ME for the frist part of our stay. What a fantastic hotel! Excellent service, especially from Carlos. The pool side was lovely and the cuisine superb. Definately try to stay in for a night and dine in the hotel's resturant. The breakfast is a bit dear if it's is not included but the staff didn't hesitate to sign us up for a MAS card which gives you 2 for 1 on breakies. LOVE IT. WE WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern cool contemporary architecture and design, a taxi ride away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Me Barcelona stands out as unique in Barcelona for me due to the attentive staff, ultra modern, clean and well thought out design of the confined suites and great lobby bar. Situated a taxi ride away from the heart of the city and a good walk away from the Sagrada Familia, Me Barcelona offers everything and more that you would expect from the Melia chain. The rooms are free of noise pollution, full of modern furniture and gadgets which could give the feel of clutter in the confined space but are well thought out in design and are very new and very clean. Room service, laundry and house keeping is excellent. I really recommend the trendy cool large lobby bar area to entertain guests or business associates. Management and Staff are always positive with a friendly presence and enough understanding to leave you to enjoy your experience on your own and confident to know when you need assistance, offering a great service from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: glendowg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is awesome! The staff goes out of their way to get you whatever you need. Rooms are sound proof with sound systems and nice TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in an up and coming area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: wardy14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ME for two nights as first stop off travelling northern Spain. Rooms excellent, spacious and well equipped. Staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast very good but expensive, however reception told us about a loyalty card which gives you 50% discount, so in the end good value. Pool area very stylish and relaxing, lots of comfy areas to lounge around. Location a bit off the beaten track but not a problem as taxis quite cheap and there is a very good shopping mall within walking distance. The smell mentioned in some reviews we found quite pleasant. All in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BMGAL
Reviews.Content: This is a place I would return to. The hotel is very stylish and the rooms confortable, however the most outstanding part for me was the staff. The friendliness and helpfullness was incredible. From check in, bar staff at the pool, room service, cleaning staff, all were very friendly, helpful and courteous. We partyed a bit (Barcelona is a party city!) so breakfast served til noon is very welcome. I would also recommend the pool area for relaxing and chilling out in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “superb styling with personal service”
Reviews.Author: H08H
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate enough to stay in the Sky Suite which is another level in space, styling and service. Lift will take you up and down to 29th without stopping. Nice Spa (allthough missing a cold water dip or shower) with great pooldeck. Restaurant Dos Cielos deserves all the acclaim it is recieving. Service everywhere in the hotel is personal, patient and knowledgeble.

Reviews.Title: “The ME would like to be ALL THAT...but it isn't”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the ME Hotel was a big disappointment. The hotel was obviously built with BIG things in mind. Consider the supposed amenities: a lobby bar and high-end restaurant on a top floor, a luxury spa and a nightclub, a lush pool deck and a groovy, international vibe. Unfortunately, few of these amenities or vibes were present on our visit. The pool deck was just plain sad, with few lounging chairs, a tiny pool, and pathetic, abused palm trees wilting in the sun. The spa was closed (apparently for good). The nightclub, "Angels and Kings", was also closed. The lobby bar was barely staffed and the "cool vibe" of the hotel decor was sadly undone by a most unusual moldy or chemical smell emanating from seemingly everywhere at once. The moment you entered the lobby the smell hit you and stayed in your nostrils. So odd. And so disturbing. The location of the hotel is not very good for exploring the city on foot, seeing as it is out of the loop by a long shot. But the front desk staff did give us maps that gave the location of the nearest Metro stop, which is only a few blocks away. In fact, the front desk staff was the best thing about the hotel. They were very helpful with directions and restaurant reservations, etc. I almost felt like they deserved a better property to manage. The rooms were fine (and very groovy, indeed) but the rest of the property seemed to need some maintenance, even though the place isn't that old. The breakfast buffet was pretty good and the coffee good and strong. It's just unfortunate that the hotel couldn't be as good and strong as that morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A modern business class hotel that isnt too badly located for tourists too”
Reviews.Author: GAGTVM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a conference(that I was attending elsewhere) and the place is quite new(as of june 2010)... the interiors are quite swanky and they have an attempt to stand out from the crowd and this is evident even in the stacked structure that is the external facade. The rooms are quiet big and very comfortable. It has a good dressing area that is close to that bathroom and tactfully tucked away from the sleeping area. Breakfast is the usual continental spread and the staff are quite courteous and very helpful. The conceirge went out of his way to source a travel adaptor for my laptop and mobile... There are 2 big malls which are a tram ride away too from the hotel and oh yeah before i forget, theres free wifi too On the negatives, the metro station is about a 10 -15 minute walk away and there are no convenience stores/decent restaurants around. This can be quite a hassle especially if you are coming back late from the city , the streets can be a bit scary though the area is safe apparently... All in all, a good place and if you get a good rate, you wont be disappointed staying here

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is ok but I would give it 4* rating at best”
Reviews.Author: CharlieFCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June having just spent 3 nights in the W Barcelona. We booked on Last Minute.com so got a cheaper price than normal room rates however it was still more expensive than other hotels closer to the city centre. We were wanting a bit of luxury for a week and thought Barcelona was ideal for a part relaxing beach/sun holiday and part city break. We only booked this hotel because it had a pool and a 5* rating. We arrived at the hotel and the check-in queue was enormous so we had a relaxing drink in the comfortable bar area. To be fair check in was quick once we got the front of the queue but the entire foyer area smelt a bit wierd. The place is trying too hard to be cool with dubious colour choices for furnishings and steel walls??!!! Our room was ok the bed very comfortable and we got a good nights sleep (we were woken every morning by the maids at about 9am though). The bathroom had no extractor ran that we could find and after a shower the condensation ran down the glass panel separating the room from the bathroom and left dirty marks on the window ledge. I wouldn't say the room was spotless but it was adequate. This hotel was in quite a poor location - ok so fairly close to the nearest tube station (10 mins walk) and tram stop (5 mins) but a way out of the city. Cabs in barcelona are fairly cheap though so this isn't really a massive issue. The worst part about our stay was that on our last day we were enjoying the sun in the pool area when we were asked to leave due to there being a private party in the area. There was no pre warning or notification of this and we had to get up and tramp down to the beach via the tube to enjoy our last day of sun (I am 5 months pregnant with twins so was hoping for a relaxing day!!!!!!!!) I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are expecting 5* luxury. If you are happy for 3-4* quality and service in a fairly poor location this hotel could just be for you!

Reviews.Title: “Good...but more form over function again”
Reviews.Author: wipeout75
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. But you do get the fealing that they are trying a little too hard to be too cool for school. Good secure car parking imediately adjacent to the hotel - not too expensive at €25 for the 1 day / night that we were there. check in staff all very nice and helpful and rooms again were nice and bright. We were on the 12th floor looking out over the outdoor pool (on the 6th floor) and sea beyond (and I mean beyond.) Tiny gym - nice equipment but not much of it and also the air con in the gym wasnt working with predictable noxious results! Other comments re the noise from the nightclub are spot on. Make sure you are on as high a floor as possible away from the pool if you want to sleep. Its clearly a very popular nightclub right now and was heaing all night until 5am. We didnt go to the nightclub but we did have cocktails in the bar downstairs. One was very nice - one was hopelessly made. In summary its nice - but would I stay again? Probably not. If spending this much I'd spend a little more and stay at Mandarin Oriental or W Hotel. Check out Pla spanish restaurant though on Bellafila 5. Very nice and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, what I'd expect from the ME, but with some drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: CS01
Reviews.Content: It's kind of hard to write this review. The reason being is, what I liked, I really liked, but what I didn't like disappointed us quite a bit. First, the good. We had stayed in the ME Madrid and really enjoyed our time, so we figured we'd try the ME Barcelona. We were attending the Primavera Sound 2010 festival and this hotel was pretty close to the festival site, so it worked out. The hotel is very modern, what we expected. It's elegant, beautiful structure from the outside. Inside is just as impressive. Once in the room, we found it to be very nice and in terms of size, very good. Overall, it was what I'd expect; modern, stylish, sophisticated. Now, the bad. We stayed on a weekend. Be warned; this hotel is basically a club on the weekends and it is extremely noisy. We were staying on the 7th floor, facing the sea. Upon returning from the festival about about 2 in the morning, we found our room absolutely intolerable in terms of noise. I can't stress enough how loud the club on the 6th floor is. Honestly, anyone staying on the sea-view side of this hotel that is within a few floors of the 6th, good luck getting to sleep. It is obnoxiously loud. So, in our very tired states...again, it's 2 in the am...we had to drag ourselves down the the lobby, then move ourselves to a new room. We selected a non sea view room, even though that's what we had paid foor and booked. Upon checking out, we still ended up paying for a sea view room, which I'm pretty sure has a premium on it in terms of cost. No deduction was made for our room not being a sea view, nor for our having to change rooms in the middle of the night. Another minor gripe is that we had wifi in our rooms at the ME Madrid and assumed that would be the case in Barcelona. Not so. We had to go to the lobby to use our phones for email etc. A minor inconvenience though. So again, a very stylish hotel and overall a very nice place to stay, just know what you're getting in to; if you're there on a weekend, and you don't want to hear thumping house music until 4 in the morning, book a room on the city view side.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, poor location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob18
Reviews.Content: It was a decently designed hotel, but lacked in many areas. I would not recommend it to others & I would not stay here again for the following reasons: - Bad location for exploring Barcelona. Not very close to any Metro stations and once you do find one, you need to make at least 1 train line change to get to the more popular destinations. It takes about 45 minutes to get anywhere worth seeing (Las Ramblas, Parc Guell, Gracia neighborhood, etc.) - very few decent dining destinations nearby - inconsistent housekeeping service (shampoo, soap, towels & drinking glasses were not refreshed) - very expensive food and drinks in the restaurants, mini bar and room service ($25 club sandwich) - no coffee maker & iron / ironing board - 2 twin beds in lieu of a queen or king - rooms were modern, but need some maintenance as the white walls and floors were pretty scuffed & artwork was dusty - hallways not air-conditioned - lobby bar was not staffed so we waited for service approx 15 minutes before asking and still not getting anyone to wait on us... We left and bought beer & wine at the gas station next door On a postive note: The beds were very comfortable & the view from the room was nice (albeit partially blocked by the exterior architectural elements of the building).

Reviews.Title: “Give it 6 stars”
Reviews.Author: joecron
Reviews.Content: I rate this, on a scale of 1 to 5, a 6. This hotel was terrific is every sense. During our stay, we were notified of a death in the family, and we had to rearrange travel plans in a hurry. The staff could not have been more helpful. If you were to hold my feet over a fire, and force me to find something bad about this hotel, I could not do so. The staff, to a person, was friendly, caring, and extremely competent. Every request was met perfectly. They could not have been better. If I were to go to Barcelona, I would not consider any other place. It was wonderful in every sense of the word.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 041212aa
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother booked a weekend trip to Barcelona in april 2010. The hotel is very fresh and hip. The room was very clean and sound proof. I have never slept better in any hotel! The staff was very helpful, gave us map and answered all our silly questions about Barcelona :) It's not located in central Barcelona, like Las Ramblas, but hey, who wants to live there?! This hotel is located just a few minutes from the Metro station of Poble Nou, and from there its like 10 mins ride to central tourist location. Otherwise, you could just walk down Av Diagonal to the city, or take the tram that stops right outside the hotel. The hotel has gym and SPA facilities (like Sauna, pool, hamam), which we used everyday (free of charge, lovely!) You really have to try this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I have never experienced something better”
Reviews.Author: AnjaZo
Reviews.Content: I am working in the IT industrie and had to travel to Barcelona. One of my colleagues recomended the ME Barcelona. I never heard about it. I thought, might be nice to try. I really have to say that I am travelling a lot and I am tired of using classical, old fashion hotels. The ME Barcelona was amazing, a contemporary design, lovley music and I felt like at home.As explained, I am working for an IT company and I must say that the rooms are really well equipped. They also offer the wifi free of charge and a lovley view over barcelona. I visited the sky food bar restaurant and had dinner and I absolutely loved it, nice and smiling staff and a good food quality. I am already looking forward to stay again at the ME Barcelona. Best regards Anja ( Germany )

Reviews.Title: “So so, but view is great”
Reviews.Author: gaspargonzalez
Reviews.Content: The ME likes to see itself as the ultimate in design, but fails in good customer service. Lay-out of the hotel rooms is a bit weird, with open bath space, strange electronic curtain system, and unclear light switches. The bed is absolutely comfortable, but nevertheless room and amenities are pretty average. Best part is the view, that is if you're located high enough. I was on the 22nd floor and had a great city view. At check-in the asked if I would like to have sea view. That would have cost me 25 euro more per night, while I think the city view was far better. As commented by many other reviewers, the service in the hotel is weak. Staff at breakfast look annoyed and send you away five minutes before closure. Staff at hotel bar is slow and ignorant. Most of the reception staff as well, with the exception of a very attentive lady from Alicante. After returning I noticed an unclear credit card charge for mini-bar. Didn't take anything, nor signed a bill. In an e-mail hotel responded they will correct it, without any apologies. In short: perfect view, average rooms, weak service. Not a true 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: firefoxLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Managed to stay at the 'level' at the 'Me', and could not recommend it enough! The staff were most attentive, my thanks esp to Claire who made our stay perfect. Rooms were spaciouse and clean, attention to detail esp impressive. Views overlooking the city with Sagrada Familla in the foreground what more could you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a Mixture”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a wonderful triumph of design... No question..... Bar staff indifferent, faffing around and taking too long..... took almost 15 minutes to get served in a very quiet bar. I actually had to ask the barman whether his bar was open... Receptionist, said I was so big my jacket must be like a house.... ok she was small and I am tall... still.... Restuarant on 24th let me sit in the bar and not serve me for 15 minutes... so I left. Prawn tempura took 45 minutes to prepare when I eventually sat down to dinner On requesting coffee with milk and sugar at room service, bit tricky, had coffee first milk and sugar followed 20 minutes later. Finally tried to get some documents printed in the business centre, it was deserted. So this could not happen,,,, and.... they don't even stock cigarettes.... Oh dear oh dear oh dear

Reviews.Title: “Super Cool Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: got2bfunky
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here as it was a potential venue for our wedding which is in Barcelona this June. Upon arrival we both knew instantly that it was the hotel that we would be staying in. Cool beyond belief, super friendly staff and excellent rates. True its not slap bang in the middle of town but has an overground tram stop 50m away and a metro station about 400m away. Rock and roll hotel at a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: baboon
Reviews.Content: Could not agree more with most recent review. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights following promotion on Travelzoo. As it was his 40th birthday we booked the Level which seemed expensive when booking but proved to be worth every euro!! Pink champagne and canapes available in private lounge with fabulous view and a brilliant concierge called Letitia for whom nothing was too much trouble. We loved the whole concept of the hotel and the chilled out music playing everyehere was excellent. Staff are extremely friendly and hotel decor has been well thought out. Breakfast was amazing and the presentation made you want to try everything. Cannot wait to go back hopefully when it is warmer and can get to use swimming pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to hard and fails on too many points.”
Reviews.Author: BackinthUK
Reviews.Content: ... all that glitters, is not gold and the Hotel Me really didn't hit a good note with me. We were here for a business convention and on first look, the hotel and the rooms look great - until you try to utilise them. The hotel is a taxi ride to any tourist areas of Barcelona or a 30 min walk. There is a decent area about 8 mins walk for restaurants but this is NOT a city centre hotel. The rooms are attempting to be model and minimalist but end up being unfunctional and uncomfortable. Here's my room issues: 1. No kettle/coffee maker in the room. Virtually unheard of in a hotel of it's "class". 2. Cement floor in room, slippery when wet and cold. Carpets, wood, whatever ... not this cheap alternative. 3. Chair at desk is not a work station chair but a cheap, "trendy" plastic design - not good. 4. Impossible to shower without getting the bathroom floor drenched. 5. The wrap around curtain on 2 walls ... whose idea was this? Only one wall is window but the curtain covers both and is VERY slow on it's automatic open/close. Furthermore, it didn't close all the way and left a 3 inch gap for the light to stream in at 6am. 6. There is a control panel for all the lights and AC. Each button pressed done something different, each time. Everybody I spoke to had this problem. 7 Outrageously priced mini-bar and room service (18Euro for a hamburger) and as your miles from anyway, it's a good weight loss hotel! Beds were good, TV was ok, other bathroom facilities good - and their maid service is some of the best I've seen. Other problems. Bar staff are worthless. People waiting to be served, while 2 of them stocked and cleaned, 1 served - very slowly. 5euro for a 330ml glass of tap beer is twice the price of anywhere we drank. Outside the elevators on every floor smelled of toilets - probably because the rooms toilets backed onto that area. Poor ventilation? Breakfast is a very generous 11am finish except at weekends when it's even better at 12noon. Arriving at 11.05 on a Saturday, we were told it was finished. Questioning why, "because we have to set up for a lunch meeting in this room". Even though we told her the note in the room said 12, when we checked in we were told 12 - she said there is nothing she could do, even though we could see a full buffet breakfast table and people eating. It was only after demanding a manager that another staff member made a call and let us in - it should not have came to this. Smokers - forget it if it rains, there is no area even remotely or partially covered outside! Overall, this hotel just failed. It has a few good points but it's not comfortable, doesn't provide you a feeling of luxury or a level of relaxation and just feels a bit like they don't know what they're doing.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning inside and out”
Reviews.Author: bencarl
Reviews.Content: Takes a bit of getting to, but worth it. Amazing views from higher rooms and great design.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, chic, but not the most comfortable”
Reviews.Author: earthjaunt
Reviews.Content: For a city that doesn't sleep very much this hotel is fine. That's because the beds were not that comfortable, and I could not get the temperature in my room to go above 22 C' even after turning the thermostat up to 27/28! The hotel is nicely decorated, and the rooms are very hip. Other issues I had included spotty wireless internet access (a must for me) and it was slow. The food in the Sky Bar (lobby) was okay, as was the bar. It was a nice place to meet up before heading out on the town or when returning to the hotel at the end of the day. All that aside I probably won't stay here again. I would prefer a more traditional hotel like a Sheraton or something closer to the old section of Barcelona, even though the ME is just blocks from our office in BCN.

Reviews.Title: “ME is the one for me!”
Reviews.Author: burgoyne
Reviews.Content: Fantastico! What a great hotel enjoyed every second of our 5 day stay. Could not fault staff in any way nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were brilliant and transport facilities were marvellous a tram stops on the road nearby. Poblenou Metro 5 minutes walk as is Poblenou Rambla with tapas bars, coffee shops, restaurants etc in the natural Spanish style. The Rambla leads down to the beasch which is wonderful it even includes a naturist area. Easy access to port olympico (4stops on Metro). Best price on Travelzoo 99E per night inc B/Fast and parking, ask for 16 floor and above and city view. You get floor to ceiling window and Barcelona in all its glory can be viewed from the comfort of your luxurios bed. Friday and Saturday night the ME is THE place to be seen the night club is buzzing up to 5am. If you want a great time in Barca the ME is the PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute and this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nad66
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Barcelona with my wife for the Elton John show. Booked 4 nights at this hotel. The room with sea view was great. Clean, Tidy, comfortable and in general we fell in love with all the hotel decoration and new look. Breakfast was wonderful and it is served until 11. The fact that the staff was so nice, wellcoming and helpful made this vacation a big success. Will definitly go back and recommend to others as well. The hotel is not in the center of town but 5 minute walk to a metro station which makes it easy getting to every important plae in town. It's also not far from the beutifull beach.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value, lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: stp1602
Reviews.Content: A group pf 9 ladies stayed here for a birthday celebration. Lovely hotel, smooth check in, great room - fab views if you have a head for heights. Most of us are well travelled and all agreed that the buffet breakfasts were the best we had ever had...even better that they were included in the price of the room! The range and quality of food offered was fantastic...smoked salmon, champagne, great selection of teas and coffees, cereals, hot food - and the most amazing array of muffins& cakes. Don't go to breakfast if you are on a diet!! Ten mins walk from the Metro, safe, residential area - very quiet. We were in barca for the festival weekend and it was heaving in town, so nice to go back to a nice quiet area. Would go back as we ddin't get time to use the Spa/Pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tim061
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 3 nights and would like to share my thoughts and experiences with you. Room The room was very modern and although small (standard city view) was kept Immaculate and was very clean. We had no problems and everything worked fine. The bed was very comfy and the pillows were nice and fluffy. The room was well lit apart from the main mirror area in the bath room which was dark preventing my girlfriend from doing her hair and make up properly. The shower was spacious and enclosed and very stylish. The rooms safe was easy to use and big enough for (laptop, camera, documents, DVD player and all valuables). The toilet area was sectioned off from the main bathroom and was clean well lit and had a heated towel rail and storage space. Our toilet in room 1007 did not flush that well but we had no other problems. The tv was nice although be careful when you check your room tab as it is misleading and you could end up ordering a movie channel at 25 euros. There was plenty of wardrobe space although no iron or ironing board in room which was one of the featurers which should have been included. There was also a mini bar available which was extortionate 7euros for a small water, 15 euros for condoms - you get the idea. Dining The sky bar restaurant was very good and had a reasonable selection of food available as with most hotels I have stayed in the quality of food is average and overpriced. We did not eat in the main restaurant as neither me or my partner could pick even one dish which we liked. I feel it was a shame as the view on the terrace at night would have been amazing. The average price for one dish was 40 euros so was very expensive. I would like to point out that drinks in the hotel are expensive and as there is no complimentary water included in your room a trip to the lidl 3 mins from the hotel is a good idea. I hate getting ripped off and refuse to pay 7 euros!!. Room service I would advise against it. Me and my partner both ordered the fettucine and sun dried tomato pasta and 45 mins later and 56 euros lighter our meal arrived stone cold and minus the tomato. A quick call to reception and 10 mins later the guy came to collect it as he did he took a call (from chef mayby??) to ask what the problem is. It was obvious he thought we were making it up and being funny but at those prices the food should have been checked before it left the restaurant. The hotel did apologise although when we received the pasta it was warm but still not great. We had no problems with dining at the sky restaurant and the breakfast although expensive at 22 euros did offer an excellent selection of fruit, cereal, bacon, eggs, sausages, ham, cheeses, tea & coffee, pastries and fruit juices. The only bad experiences we had were the room service and the refusal of an extended checkout. We could use the spas shower facilities though and they look after your suit cases in a room. I would reccommend this hotel though as the staff are very friendly and speak good English. They had a sense of humour giving us room 1007 as we were from England the porter called me James bond.

Reviews.Title: “4*- but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PrisUk
Reviews.Content: Location- Getting to the hotel from the airport was a bit of a track... we took the Renfe (train) to Passig de Gracia for the connecting metro L4 to Poblenou, however it took us 20mins+ to find the actual metro station over ground! Signage was very confusing as we expected there would have been a connecting underpass without exiting the station! Anyway got there in the end with the help from the locals (extremely helpful) and the Poblenou area is not bad at all with local supermarkets and cafes dotted around. It’s great for those who intends to spend most of their time on the beach as its only 15mins away from the hotel. Service- The blonde girl at the check-in desk was very nice and we requested a room at a higher level which she gave us a room on the 13th floor! The view was OK apart from the construction site mentioned in previous reviews. The guy at the front of the hotel was very helpful and enthusiastic, always offered to help with directions and our luggages. Overall, staff were very friendly and nice, however one point I need to make ... 1 of the hotel staff (male in his mid-20's) gave us wrong info regarding travel to the airport. He told us to get the metro to Urquinaona and get the connecting train at Catalunya station (a much quicker way according to him) which was WRONG! We spent almost an hour looking for the correct Renfe station with our suitcase and everything, walking up and down a street full of people!! It was NOT a pleasant experience… Room- Our room was a standard city view room, smallish but had everything we needed. Shower was great, bed was very comfy but the toilet was a bit claustrophobic… Previous reviews mentioned about the noise from the night club on 6th floor that’s why we requested a room at a higher level so noise wasn’t a problem for us. The swimming pool was tiny but the atmosphere was quite nice with plenty of sunbeds around. Cleanliness/ Value- Hotel room itself is fairly clean but there is a strange smell in the corridors…. I think this hotel probably deserves to be a 4*rather than a 5* hotel but I would say its value for money for the amount we paid and the service/facilities they provide. Overall a good experience…. Recommend for business/ young couples/ group of friends

Reviews.Title: “So far so Good!”
Reviews.Author: EricAndLatrice
Reviews.Content: This is our "first day" review of our stay here in Barcelona- many reviewers suggested the metro train from the airport, so that's what we did, however with the luggage we had, two carry-ons one laptop bag and a huge suitcase it became an endurance test as the rail systems is very un-modern, (very few escalators, lots of stairs and and confusing signage) the locals were helpful which was greatly appreciated since the electronic signs on the train(L2) from the airport did not correspond to the actual stops. Once we got off the L2 at Passeig de Gracia the ordeal to transfer to the L4 yellow line was a twenty minute nightmare, even the security guards gave us bad directions, we finally made to the yellow line through trial and error and many, many stairs. The yellow line ride was much better, air-conditioned with good signage. we exited the Poblenou staition and walked a quick ten minutes north to the hotel. THE HOTEL- Let me first start off by saying my wife is very particular about the hotels we stay-in she wants immaculate conditions especially when it comes to cleanliness and the ME delivered that and more. First the good, Check in was good young lady (I forget her name) with blond hair was friendly and helpful, the room, although smallest, was very clean, modern,and well appointed, the electronic curtain and different lighting selections were awesome and the view of the city was fantastic with the exception of the very near construction sites. The bed is very comfortable, the pillows extremely fluffy and soft and the overall design of the room with the see through bathroom vanity glass/partition over looking the bed very trendy and sleek.The shower area is very spacious with sensitive controls for water temp and toilet area was neat and partitioned off from the rest of the bathroom. Now the not so good, there was no concierge on duty when we arrived (7PM local Sunday) so we couldn't get a good idea where to eat or go to relax. We were told we had wireless in our room but we didn't (they gave us an ethernet cable so we plugged in instead).The hotel restaurant food was hit and miss, my chicken and vegetable dish was delectable however my wife's pasta and shrimp (recommended by waiter) was below par with only three small shrimp and not much pasta, my wife eats small portions but this was ridiculous. The bread which normally comes free was 2 euros and the water was 5. Overall like I titled this review, "so far so goo" . My wife is getting on me now for spending too much time writing this review so i must go. I' give another update for day 2 when we return tonight.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific find in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: sjbk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights pre-cruise with my parents and friends. This hotel was everything we wanted and then some. Leticia and her team on "The Level" made us feel more than welcomed and took care of our every need. Great restaurant recommendations and off the beaten path gems. My parents, who are in their 70's loved the atmosphere, as it made them feel younger and enjoyed every minute of their stay at ME. Yes, it is not that close to the Barcelona attractions, but thankfully it is removed from the crowds. We took taxis everywhere and did not pay more than 10 Euros to get to where we wanted to go. We hired a private car to take the 6 of us to Montserrat, which was an incredible journey and even stopped at the Frexinet cava for a tour and tasting. The breakfast at ME is one of the best I have had in my recent travels. This hotel is worth it and gets my highest recommendation. By the way, my friends found some incredible bargains at the El Corte Ingles Department store at the beginning of the Ramblas, so they had some new clothes for the cruise. If you want something different and enjoy unique, ME is everything you are looking for. Enjoy Barcelona in the way it should be, wonderfully eclectic.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Scapa
Reviews.Content: It seems you either love or hate this hotel. We really loved it and we are in 50s age group! Our rooms were spacious and very stylish. It is a bit out but only a few minutes walk to the metro which goes to Barcelonetta and the centre. We found the drinks expensive but we just went down to Lidl which was 3 minutes down the road. We really cannot recommend this hotel too much and our sons thought it was wonderful. We went to the beach this first day but the Pool area is so nice we just went there every day and our 19 year old who is beach obsessed even ended up here. Try to get a deal which includes breakfast as they are brilliant but I overheard that you can get the continental breakfast which is the best bit for 12 euros rather than the 22 for the whole lot. We also quite liked getting out to the local area from the busyness of the city and having a drink in the local Ramblas before bed. A bit of a treat, that was!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time! Great Hotel! A+++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Truevoice
Reviews.Content: ME-Barcelona is wonderful! I’ve stayed at several hotels all over the world and this hotel has some amenities that I have never seen before. It has a vibe like the Standard in Los Angeles but provides some very modern technology. There is a panel on both sides of the bed that controls the bedroom lights, curtains, desk light, bathroom lights and nightlight. The wifi worked great. There is a very nice business center on the second floor. Although I would suggest getting a room with breakfast, I would not suggest upgrading to the “Level” unless you’re on business. There is some great food in Barcelona, and getting out to eat dinner is my suggestion. You MUST eat at Raco De La Villa (10 minute walk from the hotel). Get the T-bone steak! This restaurant is located on the corner of Ramon Turro and Ciutat De Granada. If you want a place a couple blocks from the hotel try Los Ballotas. (The front desk will give you directions.) The hotel is a 10-minute walk from the Metro and a 15-minute walk from the beach. It will cost approx. 45 Euros to get to the hotel by taxi. I would strongly suggest that you take the train. This is what you need to do: From terminal two you need to take follow the signs for the Renfe Train. You will need to walk across a bridge to the train station. Purchase a T-10 ticket. This is a little less than 8 Euros and can be used by more than one person. (If you’re traveling with more than one person you can run the T-10 ticket for one person in your party, let them go through and then run the ticket for you and then go through the glass door. MAKE SURE you enter your ticket into the correct turnstile, otherwise you may purchase a train trip for someone else.) There are machines to purchase the tickets at the train station. I would suggest that as soon as you get off the plane to get money from the ATM. You will get the best rate using the ATM machine. Take out as much money as you think you will need for the time you will be in Spain. My bank only charges me one fee for the one transaction. If you use the ATM several times you back will charge you each time you pull out money. The exchange rates at the hotel and at the money exchange businesses are expensive. There is no ATM at the train station, therefore make sure you have at least 10 Euros to buy your T-10 ticket. Get the Renfe Train Schedule. The security guard will have a copy or you can ask for one from a Renfe attendant. The train runs every 30 minutes. I would suggest that you walk al the way down the platform to avoid the congestion of people. Take the train to the Passeig de Garcia station. Once you get to Passeig de Garcia, take the metro Yellow Line (L4) in the direction of La Pau. Your stop for the hotel will be Poble Nou. Please note that there are several flights of stairs in the Metro – and no elevators, and very few escalators – so I would recommend you pack light. Once you exit Poble Nou and come out to the street you will need walk straight and then make left on Lope de Vega. Once you walk for about 5 minutes you will see the hotel. Right before you get to the hotel you will see a gas station. You may want to buy a gallon of water there. Water in the hotel is expensive. Note: If you head the other way Lope de Vega you will end up at the beach. (FYI: Once you get to the beach, go to the beach on the right. If you go to the beach to left you will be on a nudist beach.) On the way back to Airport the Renfe Train will say Airport on the front of the train. Do not take any other train. Tipping – I talked to several of the locals and every one of them said that tipping is not necessary in Spain. They told me that the most that they do is round up. As an example we had a dinner check in the amount 118 Euros and the locals suggested that I leave 120 or 125 Euros. They stated that locals do not tip at all for a drink. I stopped leaving tips after being in Barcelona for two days and I did not feel as if I was treated any differently. I would strongly suggest that you get on the Barcelona Bus Turistic. This is a bus tour that takes you to different sights around Barcelona. It costs 21 Euros for a one-day pass and 27 Euros for a two-day pass. I would suggest that you buy the two-day pass because there is a lot to see and you will need to get off the bus to see all of them. You can purchase one of these bus passes in Paca de Catalunya. You can get here by going back to the Metro and taking the L4 (yellow line) to Urqinaona. The last thing I that I would strongly suggest that you do is to take the 30 minute train ride to Sitges. You will need to take the L4 (yellow line) to Passeig de Garcia. (Note that you can also catch the train at Estacio de Sants, but I would not suggest it. Sants is a very busy station. If you get on the train at Passeig de Garcia you will be on the train one stop before Sants and this will insure that you will get the seats you need before the mad rush of people get on the train at Sants.) The final destination of the train is either Vilanova i la Geltru or St. Vincenç de Calders – these are the names that you should be searching for on departure boards and on the front of the train rather than Sitges. There are a lot of gay men in Stiges, but the beaches are great and the village has tons of shops and restaurants. All the beaches have toppless women. Approx. 1 out of 6 women don’t wear a top. This includes grandmothers. The metro/train is a great way to save money while visiting Spain. Take a few minutes to review the maps of the subway, and if you can read a map and follow signs you’ll be just fine. Magic Fountains – a must. I have seen the fountains at the Bellagio in Las Vegas. I prefer the fountains in Barcelona. At 9 p.m. each night you view a spectacular show of water, lights and music. Finally, a couple blocks from the hotel is a street called Ramba del Poble Nou. The locals walk up and down this street and eat dinner at the sidewalk cafes. Note that most restaurants open at 7:30 p.m. and close at midnight. Before you leave for Barcelona make sure that you take a look at www.barcelona-tourist-guide.com You will find a lot of good information on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandPenney
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the ME for 9 nights, we checked out after 3, staff were very unfriendly and unhelpfull. the rooms are among the smallest Ive ever stayed in. Cannot understand how this hotel got rated with 5 star, no way, 3 star at best..The walls in room were marked, the corridors looked as if thay had never been hoovered. The sockets were loose. On the 2nd day, no one cleaned our room or made bed, we had to ring twice for toilet rolls and towels, The air con did not go down past 23. We couldnt wait to check out, we moved to the arts hotel where we found a real 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: haines01
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for 3 full days and could not have had a better holiday. The hotel is ultra swish and actually found the location to be about right. It will cost you 35 Euros from the airport, and will take approx 25 mins. (Cabbies are nutters) We stayed on the 13th floor and had a sea view which also looked over the pool. Room was beautiful and very spacious. All mod cons and everything you will need (No Iron) There is so much to do in the hotel like (Spa, Pool, Restaurant, Gym, Night Club on Saturday) We walked to the beach on the first day and did not realise how long the becahs was so settled in a nice spot which was busy but really nice. Food can be expensive but generally it is the drinks. Nice though. the one thing I would be wary of is the cost of drinks in the hotel A coke 5 Euros and vodka and Tonica 10 Euro's in the end I walked to the petrol station (1 minute walk) and bought water and cokes etc from there. Breakfast is 22 Euro's each. Very steap for what it is. More positives is the pool area. Lovely chilled pool enough beds as long as you get down about 9am and put your bag or one of their towels down. Food by the pool is lovely Service is lovely (always with a smile) Manged to get a check out at 2pm We went to two amazing restaurants: Ciutat Comtal (Rambla de Cantalunya 18) amazing tapas food. CDCL near the marina (prob the best restaurant I have ever been to) £50 per head roughly. (look on their website) I would also recommend the tour bus. Hop on hop off all day.. great to get around if you want to see everything. will definately be coming back here but will learn some more Spanish

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: truthwales
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona for a weekend city break and after examining the hotel website was very excited as to what was in store and upon arrival it didn't disappoint. Getting to the hotel from the airport was a bit pricey as we weren't sure of its location we decided to take a cab which cost about 35 euros so best to plan your journey from the airport in advance (one shuttle and metro ride is all it took as we later found out). We were welcomed by a friendly face who informed us that they had automatically upgraded our room for free and that we had a sea view. The lobby and bar areas were just as trendy as in the pictures and the room also. Great view overlooking the sea and below us a clear view of the pool area. After a hot journey took a shower and the bathroom facilities were excellent with luxury aveda products. The room was well air-conditioned which you could control and with electric curtains and mood-lighting it was easy to adjust to how you wanted it. No sign of any smell throughout the hotel as mentioned in previous reviews so they have obviously addressed that problem. As we were there for a couple of days we didn't really use much of the hotel facilities other than the bar which was very trendy and reasonably priced depending on what you were drinking.
